Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Al-Buqaqua.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O sons, I have completed this book for you, which is the last part of medical science, because it follows its consequences, and for its explanations and descriptions, I consider that I have pleased you with this treatise, which is based on surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Since surgery is practiced in our region and at all times, when it is greatly lacking, then the science of it remains; its traces are left; and a few small descriptions of it are found in the books of the Ancients, which change their interpretations and positions, to such an extent that they are closed and extended in force and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I consider that I have given life to that with the arrangement of this treatise in that second way of explanation and description and abbreviation; and because it comes with the forms of instruments of cauterization and other tools of work by addition of description, and for preparation, which is necessary cause.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	May the cause for which a good artisan does not excel in his art in our time, is because the art of medicine is long, and he has to learn before all things the science of anatomy which connects Girdle within itself since it knows the spring of the limbs and their forms, and the connection and separation of them; and recognizes the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their names, and the flexibility of them; and the pulsing veins and quiet veins, and places of sensation.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And therefore say I that "hypocrisy" which is a name in itself, makes small work and more in the art of surgery.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	May we have already said in the entrance of this book; for who does not know that I have told you about anatomy, it is not evident that he does not fall into error and cause the death of men, so many times as I have seen such ones formed in this science, and having gotten themselves from that science and those experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For I saw a doctor who had fallen ill and experienced an ulcerous abscess in the neck of a woman, and he cut some arteries of the neck flowing with much blood until the woman died between his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And I saw another doctor who thought that he had swallowed something in his stomach, which was large, and went to him and removed that thing with a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for him to be removed, and I saw that by the size of the thing and the position of the patient that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And I saw another doctor who took a fee from a duke of our land for surgery, and he put him in a black cast that was broken in his crotch; and prepared the doctor because of his ignorance, removed the fracture on the skin, with needles and threads to tighten it, and did not leave the skin breath.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	Then he removed it according to his desires, and then he prayed, and then he left it with some days and ordered us to remove the bandage; and thus, within that time, the crotch and foot were broken, and came to ruin.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called for him, and I prepared to remove the bandage, and with success there was peace and relief of their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But the corruption had already been confirmed in the member, so that he could not restrain it, and did not stop walking the corruption in the member until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who had pierced a cancerous abscess and became ulcerated in some days, within which the evil of it spread to his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	For this reason is because the hot water is pure of melancholic humor; therefore, it does not cover that it should come to you with fire of all, but that it is a member which you suffer that of all comes to you.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the surgery of the ma be divided into two operations: one in an operation to which health is associated, and a work in which danger is present in the greatest dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already done that in all places of this book where surgery is performed in which it is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to keep that away from you and not open it, so that the pages do not rob you of your way to speak and confuse you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your arms with diligence and protection of God, and your misfortunes with help and constancy.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way by the grace of God, and achieve salvation and worthy succession, and keep your terrible misfortunes of difficult healing, and put your weapons away from where you are afraid, lest it be lost in your faith and in your name; because there remains to you to glorify, and then go into the monastery and behind your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Guiliam I said: "In a few months, I will leave this world, and my soul will not be in this place."
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Don't put bad medicine; because you don't know where you are going.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by the head, in the forms of instruments and tools of cauterization, and from that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, of cutting and piercing, and of vacuums, and of blisters, and of extraction of arrows and of the same things applied to those, is well divided and ordered by the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, of restoration and dislocation, and of cure for injury and of the same things applied to those; is well divided by the head, in the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization by fire and by acute medicine and recollection of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that beginning begins the treatise of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	I will tell you the quality of the healing things of that cauterization and of the dangerous things of it, and in what combination it should be forbidden.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the healing thing of cauterization and of the dangerous thing of it is long and prolix, subtle by science, and hidden away; and from it to speak a great multitude of wisdom, and from it I agree, and for me it is enough with a small part of their speeches, threatening length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore I say that cauterization brings together all the combinations universally, which is made of one substance or another; except two combinations, which are combinations of half and half substances.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the combination of dry and half-dry substances, there is a disagreement; for some say that cauterization is helpful to that, and others say the opposite, that cauterization is not suitable for dry and dry diseases which are quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is not suitable for disease that is dry and dry to be cured.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And he who says that opposite of this is true, that by cauterization it is made to heal in all kinds of malady and dry that comes out in men's bodies, because when you compare the man's body with the fire's humidity, the man's body becomes wet.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the speech of that person, which I have already experienced some times and discovered it myself.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But nevertheless I do not cover that it comes upon this one what already has been exploited and exercised in the chapter of cauterization by later exercise, and knows the diversity of the man' complexions and the dispositions of the illnesses in their methexes, and the causes of those, and the accident of their, and the space of the time of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	But in the other complexions, it is not upon you a fear, and more in the dry and wet illnesses, because all the illnesses are agreed about them, and they are not agreed in the healing by cauterization of those ones.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And you know, children, that of the secret of healing by cauterization by fire and of its goodness, it is upon cauterization with medicine that burns, because the fire is simple, the action of which does not reach except to the member which is cauterized and does not harm the other member by small damage.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	But the action of burning medicine reaches to that in the members which it makes dry, and hard it brings about pain in the ill member which is difficult to heal and hard to endure.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	But the fire, by its smallness and by its substance goodness, does not make it but that it is superfluous; And I have already known it through experience and through length of service in studying about truth of causes; and for this one I am excused from the length of the speech And if it were not that it is not read to you secretly because I am afraid, the quality of the operation of it in the bodies and its expelling by which it expels the illnesses, would be made clear through philosophical demonstration, which would serve to sharpen your wits.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you know, children, that the seasons are opposite for the time when it is convenient to make cauterization and pause the best time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the damage by the accident of time is submerged in the healing power of this one which is made to come out by cauterization, and more if the cauterization is for pains or necessary pains, hard and sharp, which do not suffer delay because it is feared from those who bring about evil, which is greater than small damage entering by the time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus you shall not judge in your wits, or children, this one is not considered but the common people and the foolish illnesses, so it is that to that illness which is healed by cauterization is convenient at all times, and pause that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not good like this one where they are concerned by it, because cauterization is only in place of medicine which changes the complexion and dries the humidities which are the cause from which pains come.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless cauterization on medicine by impulsiveness of its goodness and the excellence of its operation and greatness of its lordship.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the illness which has been administered to it by cauterization returns in some hour of the time, according to the complexion of the patient and the location of his illness, and the goodness of it; and because it is prepared in its bodies by addition of superfluities to it, and because it is obtained from it in its acquisition in foods and resemblances of those causes; but if the illness for which cauterization was administered is a subtle one in some member of few superfluities and humidities, then by cauterization of teeth because of pain and resembling that, it is possible that in it does not return that pain, but comes little.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And but a vulgar speech is that cauterization is the last medicine remedy, and it is an unjust speech to those who understand it in it, because I think that it is not a healing that profits from medicine or any other cause, but by cauterization.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is opposite to that; and I think that cauterization is the last medicine remedy only when we administer the ways of healing in some illnesses, and those medicines do not provide, but at the end of the cause we administer to it by cauterization, and profit from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And then I say that cauterization is the last medicine remedy, not according to the speech which I understand from the common people and foolish illnesses.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that cauterization in gold is better than cauterization in iron, and did not say this one but because of the equality of the gold and its smallness.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place of cauterization does not make it break, because I have already seen and touched that it does not do this one but in some members which have others, and cauterization with fire is good and better than cauterization with iron as they said; but when you make cauterization with gold by fire, it is not known to you, because it is made according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive it; and if you put on it without noticing, it melts the gold into the fire, and case in the fire some sheets so that the artisan works hard with it because of its occupation.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And by it is made cauterization with iron, we must put it gently and carefully to the right operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in cauterization according to the other chapters, and I have ordered those of the book within the pages, so that you ask this one what it wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of cauterization for headache by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers to humidity and cold on the servile accident of which there are two causes, so it is a cause of soda and many types of flux raumatic, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the arms and ears flowing, and many types of sleeping, and toothache and gumache, and generally all kinds of illness that come because of coldness.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cauterization is this one, that first you command to the patient which is made to come out by lacative medicine on his head pronouncing, for three or four nights, according to whether you demand the goodness of the patient and his age and his usual clothing.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then you command him to shave his head with a razor, and then he sits between your legs on a bench and puts his hands on the top of his feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then you put the edge of your hand on the side of his nose between his ears.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But nevertheless, when this one tells about the place where it is coming from, it signs that place by trial, and then makes this cauterization which is made in this way:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then you put it on the place gently, in a way that it descends, and by which the patient's hand is forced little by little, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then you lift your hand gently and look at the place, and if you see already some quantity of hair from the head, as well as the amount of dirt that it has on it, then you raise your hand, and if it does not turn to iron, then from another one, because it is cold, before it turns out to be hair which I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then you take a little salt and dissolve it on the place and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And place it on the cot hidden in the border, and leave that one on the inside which is destroyed by fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And cure that wound with fourfold bitter medicine until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they say that when the Roman plague broke out, so too did the barley, for it is better and more nourishing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that it should be cauterized within the bone itself, and that it should retain the cautery within so that a part of the bone's surface is burned.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then have it shaved that is close to the bone, then heal it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the back of the bone, firmly pressing it within so that the bone does not break, and this is the way to cut a small piece off:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They estimate from that location the vapors from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And it should be kept open for a long time, and then heal within so that it hardens.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	Perhaps I do not see these two types of cauterization as much, but rather in some cases out of fear; and leave that one to be better for it is the salvation, when it is so; because the head is a part of continued movement, especially when the head of the patient is fevered.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cauterization is more saved and better in my opinion; and from that one, I do this work to save it, and then heal.
Capitol segon.	Second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the head cauterization.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in total the head causes chronic and long-lasting pain and water is present in the patient for a long time, and uses of scatters and poultices and calques and ointments and plasters and balms and other things, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with another cautery, then consider that because the head is of strong creation in its nature; and it does not cause great harm or damage, then cauterize it again with a little bit of another cautery.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that one on the corner of his head with a cauterizer within so that the bone is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Then cut the bone and uncover it from the quantity that we have counted, and cauterize that one in the back of the head at the location called "vas" — and that is the place where wind blows.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And praise your mother in such, and do not uncover the bone, for the patient's water causes great pain different from the pain of all the other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should direct this cauterization to its location, for because the cautery with which the head's corners are cauterized is less subtle than that with which the crown of the head is cauterized, and this is the way of it.
Capitol ters.	Second.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of cauterization of the emigre who has not been ancient.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When the pain at the back of the head is hard, or there is a painful pressure within the ear, have the head emptied by medicine, and administered to it the other cure, which I spoke of in the various types of illnesses; and if that does not help, then cauterize it with burning and iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	Perhaps cauterizing with burning medicine is better than taking an ale of honey, and scorching that one and rubbing the ends of both sides of the head.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then cut the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp needle within so that it reaches its hidden location, then keep it covered.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press tightly over it with a constricting bandage, and leave it for three hours; then pour the honey, and leave the plague for two or three days, and place it on the cot hidden in the border, so that the area hardens.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then heal that one with cold medicine until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you have them, prepare some of the burning medicines that I wrote in the second medical treatise.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Perhaps cauterizing with iron according to this method:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a small wedge, because the head has such a form in which there is a slight curvature, and in its middle is a little prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it on the location of the pain, and hold your hand back — so that the iron does not burn the skin which is left behind — and turn the small iron quickly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of skin that is removed by the edge of the bone is about a quarter of it, and raise your hand up so that the artery is not removed from the part which is left behind, so that blood does not flow out freely.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then wrap the cot in salt water and place it on the location, and leave it for three days; then remove the wrapped part from the border, and heal it with cold medicine until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see it, cauterize at the end of the knife according to the cauterization method, and be careful not to cut the artery in this emigrant who has not been ancient.
Capitol quart.	Fourth.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of cauterization of the ancient emigrant.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat the ancient emigrant with the water that we have spoken of in the previous cure, and with the water that we have spoken of in the various types of illnesses, and if that does not help, and sometimes because of the illness itself which does not contain enough water for the first cauterization with medicine or fire, then consider that you ignite the cauterizing knife within so that it whitenizes, because it signifies over the location of the pain with a long line from which most of it comes, or that one; and place your hand back for a second time, and tightly hold the small iron and turn it quickly.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, you must be careful not to damage the continuation of the jaw, which is very important for chewing, and that the tongue is not removed, and that it does not become paralyzed; and that a spasm does not occur.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if you are careful about the flow of blood from the artery which is cut off, because when one cuts it, there is a fear, and more so than that which does not know how water flows and does not study it and does not expect it; then leave the operation on the patient at the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I come back to the memory of the regiment of the accidental flow of blood from the iron according to its method, in its location of freedom.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if this illness does not help that type of cauterization, and the patient can tolerate it, then heal the plague within so that it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you see it, administer the cauterization which we spoke of in the second part of the iron method using two knives, and it is better cauterization and more certain.
Capitol .v.	First.
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of cauterization of the pain of the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When the ear hurts because it is scratched and the pain is treated with soothing medicines and the other cure which I spoke of in the division, and if the pain does not come back, then burn the cauterization, and this is the one that has no precise point, and this is the way:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then place the point of the knife close to the ignition, and direct it towards the entire ear as it is rolled over, or around each semiluna if the pain is in any one of them.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with the knife' edge along the ear slowly and carefully, so that you do not hurt the location with trying to touch it.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cautery must make points all around the foot, and then bring it up, and appropriately heal the wounds that are there so they can be healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the Cauterization of Scurvy.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Scurvy is cured and cauterized with spices that come through the blood, as we have said in the division of scurvy diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterizing with a spice that comes through drought or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that species of scurvy with poultices and calms and gulping, and do not confer your cure, then consider that you cauterize the patient with three cauterizations: the first on the ear, and the second a small cauterization on the thigh, and the third on the union of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And pause the small cauterization for the opposite of the scurvy departure, for softening does not happen except in the part that is healthy and whole.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	And the form of cauterization is that you cauterize it with the cauterization on the right side of the tip of the ear, placing a small one on top of the hairline, and in the thigh, whose length should be according to the length of the said poultice, and pause your hand so that the quantity of the spice is burned up by half.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterization, which is especially for the knife, the shape of which is placed before you.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But even more it is that this one little bit also comes to its ends; and consider that the knife does not cut in vain a little.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then heal the wounds with water that is before it is healed so that they can be healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	On the Cauterization of Old Apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When old apoplexy is and you do not confer your medicine to the patient or there is no fever, then cauterize it with four cauterizations: on all the hairlines of his head; and on the cauterization and the middle place of his head, as we have said; and on the chin.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the way to do the cauterization is to do it according to what has been said before.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And then it is cauterized on top of the stomach's mouth; and more so; and it should be carefully healed with water that you heal before.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	On the Cauterization of Oblivion Caused by Flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Then give the patient in the beginning large poultices and pills with the servant shouting.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	And then shave all of the patient's head and place it on his chest, covered by a cloth described in the book about plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And pause that one for a few moments, for that is a way to cauterize.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	And make water according to the order that we have said before.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	And thus if by that one it is healed well; and otherwise, then do three cauterizations on the back part of his head, which are sent down from the top-most part of the head to the back part within the hairline.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And pause between each cauterization the thickness of the said water, and appropriately heal the cauterization with water that is proceeding.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	But if you add to the patient water they can bear, then do the cauterization in the middle place; and if you have added more, then cauterize it on top of the hairline on either side.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	And appropriately heal that one within so that it can be healed; and make the olive-shaped cauterization according to the form that was placed before you.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the Cauterization of Paralysis and Softening of the Whole Body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Then process in the head's healing with poultices and water that we have said; and shave the patient' s head, and cauterize it in the middle place of the head, and on all the hairlines, and on the back part of the head, and on the three places of the neck.
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	And if it is necessary in the softening of the body to those who can bear it and the disease is strong, then cauterize that one with four cauterizations on the back places, and most importantly make the hand hot so that the spice is burned up by half, and hold it.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	And then heal that one within so that it can be healed, and this one is olive-shaped cauterization.
Capitol .x.	Chapter X.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the Cauterization of Epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized with epilepsy, but this one is caused by the blood.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Then give the patient a strong poultice to begin with and another cure that we have said in the division when the disease is great and the patient can bear the experience of medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not suffer the medicines, then administer gulping and chewing with the servant healing, before water for two days, with the good-tasting food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And then shave the patient' s head, and cauterize it with one cauterization in the middle place of the head according to the previous way, and another cauterization on the top of the head, and on each hairline; and cauterize the patient' s skull.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can bear it, then cauterize that one with all the mentioned cauterizations, in having paralysis and softening of the body on the spine of the neck and back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And make olive-shaped cauterization according to what has been said before.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause with a small cauterization according to this way.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	On the Cauterization of Melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupt blood and gross flame, then cauterize that one with all the cauterizations that we have said when in having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excess flowing to melancholy, and the patient' s body is moist, then give that one water to heal the brain according to the water that has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the patient' s head, and then make it red with a poultice placed on top of the circle, and then pause that one in the middle place of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And the patient may be given six cauterizations, and it is held by all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then pause with a ointment; and it is more worthy to go before sheep-shearing.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And burn that one over the fire by warm heat according to measure, which tells him when it is too hot or not hot enough.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put that one in the middle place of the head on the circle, and let it rest so that it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And make water with the patient once a week and give him the other cure that we have said or, if you prefer, cauterize that one with very small points according to what is most appropriate for him: this is a special way of cauterizing that wets the brain with equality.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then pause that one that is red in sheep-shearing or gray-blue.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	On the Cauterization of Descending Water in the Vein.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you hear the beginning of water in the vein by the signs that we have said in the division, then begin and give the patient water to heal his head, and keep that water from all moisture.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make this man's bath in water for several days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then order him to shave his head, and cauterize this man's scalp; then cauterize this man's two temples with two cauterizes if it is the beginning of water in two holes, or a single cauterization if it is the beginning of water in one hole.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Then cut with a cauterizer all the veins and arteries that remain tied up; and let the cauterizes be in that length in the latitude of the temples.
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And beware of any bleeding from the cauterization; and if there is any bleeding from him, stop it with some medicine, which is at your disposal.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And I will bring you a wisdom that is in the extraction of veins and in the absolution of those, and beware of any bleeding from him.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And some veins are cauterized in his neck with two cauterizes that run along the bones.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of the Cauterization of Ancient Tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When the tears of the eyes are ancient and dry, flowing through the veins and arteries that are in the prominent place of the head, and it is seen that they are superfluitatio fluxs of phlegm, then cauterize this man with a cauterizer that we have described in the beginning of water flowing into holes, and cauterize this man's scalp with one cauterization, and two cauterizes on each temple, and two cauterizes at the base of the neck where the bones are.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if you want to add more, then cauterize this man' entire jawbone at the base of the skull, on the outside edge of the ear, with a small cauterization.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the Cauterization of the Smell from the Nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat this man with water that we have described in the division and do not profit from your treatment, then prepare three cups of wine for the patient to drink; and then cut his hair short, and cauterize him half with a cauterizer and the other half with an olive cauterizer.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize this man with a garlic cauterizer on each of his two ears, leaving the hair a little short.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And beware of any burning that you do not set it on fire.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And this is the form of the garlic cauterizer.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the Cauterization of the Softening of the Eyelids of the Eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, then cauterize it with a cauterizer shaped like this moon; and this is how to do it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you want to, then cut his hair short on both sides of the face with two cauterizes, and make them long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cauterizer be according to the amount of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	Do not squeeze your hand too much with the cauterizer, according to the quantity that a third of the eyelid is softened.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Of the Cauterization of the Eyelid of the Eye When the Hair Turns to the Inside and Sticks to the Eye.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hair of the eye turns to the inside and sticks to it, cauterize it in two ways: either with fire or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If your cauterizer has fire, order the patient to look up at the sky where the hair will burn off, extending and twisting it; and if it sticks, then tie the eyelids tightly with a cloth so that he does not hurt himself.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then tie the hair tightly and twist it, then pause the patient's head on his shoulder, and put a seal on his eyelid with a ring, which is according to the figure of a sword, and this is the beginning of the seal near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then put an egg in white wine or a grape juice on the eyelid.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the cauterizer, and this is the form of it:
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize on the shape that you have described, little by little, making it look like a fire of thyme, completely burning the surface of the hair, which is thus, as it were, surrounded by a sword of oak.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The seal of health for this work is that you see the eyelids of the eyes already contracted and the hair of the eyes lifted by the cauterization.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Then lift your hand up and hold it like this for three days, then put it down on the egg white or grape juice.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that man with oil within, so that he is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if for some reason the hair turns to the inside and the eyelid is softened again, then make the cauterization again after the first one.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hair is in the eyelid below, then cauterize it so that it rises to its natural place and does not stick to the eye; and may the hair not touch the eyelid.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But your cauterizer has burning medicine; command the patient to look up at the sky where the hair will burn off, extending and twisting it; and may it be bound with a cloth so that he does not hurt himself. And may the shape of the cauterizer be like a fire of thyme.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. .i., o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take care to clean and prepare your instruments, and let your hands be ready for the work. Chapter XVIII. Take care to clean and prepare your instruments, and let your hands be ready for the work. Then mix those two causes together, and make a paste of it so that it is not dried out; and then spread the paste on the cloth in the form of a fire of thyme, and put it on one side of the eye; and put the other eye on the other side; and pause the patient' head on his shoulder; and put an egg in white wine or grape juice on the eyelid.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	Then pause it on the medicine and hold it for a little while; and do not squeeze your hand too much with the medicine, according to the amount that the patient feels the burning of the medicine, for the burning is in his eye.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	Then when you see that the medicine has a bitter taste, then let it rest and wash your hand with water; and then consider whether the eyelid has been raised already by itself when it was washed, as it should be; and if not, return to the medicine on the spot where it has not been wet, for it will not harm you; and if it is too hot or too cold, make a mixture of it with water.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then put it down on the edge of the cloth where the hair has been cut off, so that it is removed from the irritation, then treat that man with oil within or another medicine, so that he is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	You must be vigilant in your work so that the medicine does not get into the eye, and if the hair sticks to the eyelid, then repeat your medicine on that spot where it has been softened, and properly there, as it begins, put an egg white or another medicine to be healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the form of thyme.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	You should know that the eyelids of men vary according to their size and age. And so, according to water, your remedy will be prepared.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the way to make this remedy from those who study it in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the Cauterization of a Fistula that is in the Lacrimal of the Eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula that has been mentioned in the division of the thighs and do not confer with your treatment, then consider that you cauterize it according to this method: command the patient to keep their head still on the table, and have a minister hold their head some distance between their thighs so that it is neither disturbed nor agitated by the patient's head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then put a warm wax or a paste of wool on the patient's neck.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Then light the cauterization from which this form is made:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is concave, thus with a curved end or a pointed end, from one end of which the cauterization is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if it goes in, let it penetrate to the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to go out thus with an effort.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, the concave one is better for the work of the hand.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press on the fistula if it is open, and clean and dries it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then put the cauterization on it which is well lit, and at the same time place the patient' hand or the servant' hand on the side of the nose, so that the patient' hand or servant' hand does not feel the heat of the cauterization, and then put the cauterization on the root of the nose and corrode it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And if at the beginning of the hand' cauterization it penetrates into the bone, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization one or two times, if necessary, and leave it alone for three days, and then put a paste of oil on it around and inside to dry up so that it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	However, if it has not healed in eleven days, then put on it an acute corrosive medicine and cut it according to what you have said in the patient' chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way of cauterizing a fistula that they first mentioned: Go to the site of the fistula and then pierce it and put in it an amount of molten lead; and let your hand be over it, and do not let the lead reach the patient' neck so that it burns the fistula, and then consider that you have cauterized it and dried it up with incredible healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with water that we have mentioned in the cauterization and treatment, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to administer a trumpet from the nose and reduce the fistula to its root according to what will come out at its own place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the Cauterization of a Cut or Wound on the Skin.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	It often happens that wounds or cuts appear on the lips, and most often on the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those wounds or cuts with water that we have mentioned in the division of the parts and do not confer with your treatment, then consider that you cauterize them thus:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	Is it in its cavity according to the subtlety of a knife blade.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then put that well-sharpened knife into those wounds so that the cauterization reaches the edge of the wound.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	Then heal it with cerume so that it heals.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the Cauterization of a Fistula in the Mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When there is a boil in the soft palate or the hard palate or the teeth, it bursts and bleeds, and then it is broken and raw, and then it forms a fistula, and you do not confer with your treatment, then consider that you ignite the cauterization according to the quantity that is received in the fistula, and then put that burning cauterization on the root of the fistula, and at the back of it make it burn so that it reaches the edge of the fire on the edge of it, and once or twice more; and then heal it with water that we have mentioned in treatment so that it heals.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the healing has dried up and it has healed, it is good; and if not, then it is necessary to expose the site and remove the bone according to what will come out at its own place.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the Cauterization of Teeth and Softening of Veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened by moisture and the teeth are loose, treat them with medicine and do not confer, then consider that you place the head of the patient on the table, and then put the tip of your hand over the vein so that it does not reach the patient' hand, and immediately put the fire-lit cauterization into the tooth, quickly; and let your hand be over the patient' hand so that the heat of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and then repeat the cauterization a few times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then place the patient' mouth in a bowl of salty water and hold it for an hour, and then wash it out, because the loose tooth is stuck and the softened gum is tightened and the corrupting moisture is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the Cauterization of Toothache.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When toothache is caused by cold or heat, or it does not confer with treatment by medicine, then cauterize it on the edge of a cow or fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cauterization on the edge is that you take cow's blood and boil it, and then put a knife blade in it, and then wrap it around the end of the tooth, and quickly put the boiled blood on the tooth until it is heated.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Then repeat that cauterization a few times within which the virtue of fire reaches the edge of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see it, dip wool or a knife in the blood, and put it on the tooth, and then put a burning knife into its cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization by fire is that you attend to the whetstone of iron or of steel, and it is in the center of it with some thickness, and the acuity of the fire does not reach the patient' mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then light the cauterization according to its form, and then put it on the tooth, and let your hand be over it so that the cauterization is heated; and make water a few times because the pain remains or on this day or on another day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	Then consider that by the power of that fire, which the patient holds in his mouth with good edge, it keeps it for an hour and then washes it out, and this is the form of the cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize it according to what you see fit, as it is possible for you.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the Cauterization of an Extropulum.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When the extrophulus is made of slimy or fluid humors that are not obedient to medicine by swallowing, and you see the digestion of them slightly, then consider that you light the cauterization which is concave in form, having two open ends so that the smoke reaches the other end, and put it on the swelling a few times, and then consider that you put the burning cauterization on one end of the swelling, and then put it on the other end so that it burns; and then heal it with water that we have mentioned in treatment so that it heals.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then pause the cauterization according to the quantity of the abscess, and let it rest for three days and pause over it in the border inside until it has healed so that the fire has burned it up.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	Then clean those wounds and bandage them well until they are cured.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the tube or the cautery is such that it can be turned.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter. XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization for warts and constriction of the bile.
