E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And so insert it into the sharp turns with a strong thread of oil, and the thread should be of the quality which you fill the bag with medicine, that it is scalded according to the quantity of the tolerance of the patient; and beware that it is not too long or too short.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient is placed on his back, and his legs are raised up, and a sheet is placed under them, and the minister takes the bag and squeezes it with two hands and expresses it into the budel with all vigour until all of the water which is in the cutting comes out; and then remove the cutting and take away the patient.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces it to sleep, then take as much as it can; and if it sleeps for a long time, then it should be followed with a wakefulness in the morning.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	And if you cut it with salt water and sleep it, then repeat the cure until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the buttock there are painful hemorrhoids or blisters, then use a cutting with a sharp edge and a small one, since the children are judged by those.
De curacio de las plaguas.	Of treatment of wounds.
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have said and I will describe the division of treatment of wounds which is suitable for free ones, and I will describe it as follows:
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Thus I say that the wounds are different according to where they are made and according to the place where they occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which the wounds occur are as follows: by a fall from a height, or an incision of a knife, or a cut with a lance, or an axe, or an arrow, or similar to those which are the causes of the wounds.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	May the plagues that are in the places of the body also be with these plagues which come over the head, or collarbone, or foot, or belly, or back, and similar to those of the members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I recommend the cure of some plagues so that this reasoning and disorder about other plagues stops.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the plagues of the head, since the recollection of the components will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Then say that when it happens in the head simple plague and is not a fracture, consider: if it is by consumption of food or by similarity, and has already trinquada the knuckle so only and is a great plague and you are afraid about this patient having an apoplexy, then you get up and bleed the head quickly, and do not delay; and extracts according to the amount of the virtue of him if there is no more reason to bleed, greater if the disease that has come out from the plague is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And be the bloodletting of the opposite of the infected part; and keep the patient from repletive things, and from strong drinks.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	May if there is a prohibition of any cause, then it is diminished by the food and do not approach meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And pause on the plague, if it happens to him apoplexy in oil rosy only or in wine in which is stipticated.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	May if it is sure of apoplexy in oil, then pause on the plague, if it is new why he has third and the air has not changed that powder which I recommend to apply lightly.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed that, then pause on the back in oil until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	May if the plague is great or is by incision of knife and by similarity, and their lips are not closed by pustules, then adjust them with surgery according to what I recommend about the suture of them.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	May if the plague has already been discovered from the bone and it is not retaining it but only a small stopper, then cut it off and cure the plague with medicines and restore the meat to its place of knuckle, and order to the patient that he eats drinks in which it is grossness: capons e formens coyts and similar to them, within that it is compost.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if there is putrefaction in the knuckle and does not adhere to the bone, then you cut all of it off and flush it with water, and cure it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	May if these plagues are an artery or vein from which a flow of blood may come out, and is not extinguished by medicines, then you inquire about the artery, and if there is any non-extinguishment, then you cut it with a scalpel, or pierce it; and if necessity causes that what we have said does not respond, then you cauterize it within that the disease be extinguished.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, the cause of them is ignorance; and if you sprinkle on them this powder, since solidified before that the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the way of the powder is this: take an oil of a split part, two splits of dragon's blood, three splits of non-extinguished matter; all mixed together and shaken, and if the plague is filled with it, and constrained by good contraction within that it does not adhere to it, and coagulated with the third.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And you tighten that on top of it with powder and let it sit there, and do not remove it while it is like this that it does not apoplexy, since it has not received the medicine within that it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And any time you make water only with caution, when it is not at your place in present oil and dragon's blood.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this operation in the great plagues when you consider that it is necessary to pause on them and be straightened, and are only plagues recently of their third part, whose air has not changed those.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, and especially when it is in summer time, then do not put this powder on their position, but instead, cure those with water that we have said, perhaps you pause on their legs covered with a kind of oil which does not adhere to them, or you pause on their wrists with flour of bread soaked in water within that it creates a kind of poultice; and cure those with the other cure within that they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	May if it happens to you on a fracture plague in bone, and it is small, then you extract water with gestures.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will direct the cure of fractures in the head in poison.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the neck plagues.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	May if it happens to you on a neck plague, then it is not in its difference of medicine, and between the head plague when it is simple.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	May if the nerves of the neck are incised or arterial, then they are not in their difference of medicine but are avoided with water that does violent stypticism, perhaps with vinegar and similar to them because it is hot on the nerves and contraction there.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And you do not pause on the plague for any reason of all break, since the substance of the nerves is broken and the continuation of it is at the neck, which is the pus of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if water with the medicine is used, perhaps with an infusion of rose water or not-rose water, and wash it when it is washed with double water and the other roots are poured as follows, and wet them.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	May if the plague is great, then administer surgery, or cut the lips of it, and cure it with powder within that it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	May if the plague is deep or happens to it at the pus that has been softened, then pierce it in its most depressed place.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	May if the plague has already been incised into an artery and there is a flow of blood coming out, then you separate or dry it up, or pierce it, or cauterize it if necessity forces you to water.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	May if the bones of the jaw have already been incised and all the veins of the neck are saved, then you adjust the lips of the knuckle with surgery on the hair of it and do not touch that; before equalizing that and reducing it to its natural shape, and let it sit for a few days; and cure it with water in which stypticism and excitement have been added within that it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	May if the plague has already begun to decay in bone, then beat that, and if there are fragments of it, extract all that you can; and if water is not fitted, let it sit within that the plague decays, and separate it and the relief from it is made.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is new then sprinkle on it the powder which I have recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	May if the plague has been fated as a fistula, then cure it with water in which the recollection will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Of neck plagues or similar to them when they happen between the shoulders and are fated as a wound, or as a cut, or as a lance, or similar.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a stab with a sword or a cut, and its depth, then consider if the patient faints; then you will know that the plague is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the plague is new why he has third, then you pause in it the powder for the first time, and do not tighten it so that the plague does not adhere to the patient in the depth of it and returns to its heart, and let it sit a few days; and free those two times each day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if the needle is not at your hand, then place it in the opening of the pouch where water collects so that it sucks out moisture; and have the patient sleep on the pouch so that water runs out into him.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	Or if three days or more have passed since the poultice has been applied to the patient and no spasms or tremors occur in his body or constriction of his bowels, and at times other good conditions are present in him, then know that the poultice is effective; and then treat it with cold water and internal medicine until he is cured.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	Or if the patient's recovery is delayed and the wound has been open for a long time, then know that it has become a fistula; treat it therefore with the root.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	Or if the poultice is due to a cut or knife wound, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or leg, then treat it with water that has been preceded by suturing, if it is deep, or with powder, if it is shallow.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	Or if it has already been eaten into the bone, and there are only a few pieces left in the wound, then twist the poultice and draw out those pieces with a hook, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	Or if they are not separate, then leave them in place, as it is easier to remove the poultice than to extract the pieces from within.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And of other accidental poultices on the other members, the cure is the same as that which has been said for this one.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of poultices for the womb.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The discomfort that occurs in the womb is great, slight, or intermittent.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of great obstructions, the intestine or nerves of the intestine are involved, causing an interference with their function and their suture becoming more violent and more delicate.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	A small obstruction is difficult to treat in any way, and if you do not remove the cause of their obstruction from its place soon, for it will become more difficult, because it becomes thick and difficult because of the instrument's involvement.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	The middle obstruction is the best to deal with, because in this case the reduction of the intestine is not difficult; on the other hand, if it were a small or great obstruction, it would be more difficult to treat, as has been said above.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that a suture of the womb is second only to four ways; two sutures are common to all other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two more proper sutures communicate with the rest of the poultices; however, they are only proper for the wound of the womb.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	I also recommend to you each exposure and description.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Then say that when the poultice is small and there is no cause of the intestine to be removed from it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then it is in one of two ways: either because of the smallness of the obstruction as we have said, or because the intestine is inflated towards the bowels by the cold air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so, when water is like this, then know that you should cut it off, rather than to immerse a sponge or a damp cloth in warm water, or to take water from the sea, and hyssop, and spearmint, and immerse it into the intestine, so that the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	Some of these water are also effective in resolving the inflammation, and it is better to use these than warm water alone for this purpose.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And then know that if you see the inflammation is resolved, then immerse the intestine into water in which it was laid up and dried, because by water it is relieved for a few causes.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	Or if the intestine cannot be cured with this treatment, then cut off the obstruction with a small instrument where the hemorrhoids are inserted.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	The first cure is the best, because it is proper that there be no section, and no occupation of drying it out unless necessary and depleting.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	As for the instrument, consider its shape:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	The one side of the instrument is acute, and the other is not acute, and the end is delicate; it should not be at the end of a spikelet, because it would be obtuse, and slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And if the poultice is enlarged and the intestine protrudes, then know that the reduction of it should be according to its natural shape in its place; if possible on top of it, because the best is:
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	Or if the obstruction is wide and in the lower part of the abdomen, then place the patient on his back, and raise his legs higher than his head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then place the head of the patient higher than the feet.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And apparently, if the obstruction is in either of the two parts of the abdomen, then pause your attention and consideration at all times so that the part where the poultice is may be higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And then know how to administer water in the large and small poultices.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	In small poultices, prepare water as you see fit; and place the instrument between your fingers, which has the whole obstruction under it and adjusts the edges of it; and uncover that part to where you see the suture, if there is any cause of the obstruction from its place.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common way of suturing: one in which you take the needle, or count the needle according to the quantity of the width of the poultice; and then leave the end of the obstruction on the ring finger, and tighten the needle, or another that you do not insert into the two extremities of the knot, both extremities of the line that is within the two extremities, so that it may penetrate that part; and you have added two extremities to the knot and made four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then leave the end of the stitch double-knotted, and then add two extremities together, and then add two sides to the knot, and then leave that part; and then take the thread back to where you want it, and then tie that thread tightly around the other; and then add the width of the thread to the end of the stitch; and then tie that thread as well; and do not cease to cut the thread if necessity dictates until you have completed the entire construction of the poultice.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And let the fine and delicate needles pass smoothly through the flesh, because the delicate needles pierce it easily; and the thick ones are difficult to wrap in a knot, so that by water they become fine and subtle and thick.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And know that the needle is not fixed to two extremities of the knot next to each other, so that the flesh is not easily pierced and the poultice does not fall apart before it is consolidated.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not make long stitches, lest the poultice be prevented from being consolidated.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut off the ends of the stitches so that the patient does not feel them; and place the stitches between the expanded particles of all parts, which have the extremities of the needles; and leave them where you know that the poultice is already consolidated.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these ways of stitching with needles are most convenient in small poultices, because you need only one needle or two or three threads.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	Or the second stitch is similar: and you treat it with four extremities, of the knot and two extremities of the line, in one thread, with a needle that is wrapped up in the thread, in subtility and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And when I place the needle into these four extremities, return the needle from that middle point where you start it, so that the thread pulls back up from its low point to the plica, so that the suture is a good and strong suture of cloth where the cloths are tight.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And put between each stitch the quantity of the thickness of this thread.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this stitch will hold the men together.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this stitch I sewed the plica which was broken in a man in his belly, which had been struck by a knife, and it was the breaking of the main plica, two palms from its main side, and it was the rupture of the main member; and then I reduced that which had broken up the main part for 22 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plica was consolidated in the space of 15 days or so, and I healed it; and then there were pus and it turned black, and its condition changed.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other members had not healed; and for a miracle it was cured, because I did not heal that with ointment, for it was in a place where ointment is not attracted or any medicine, but I applied a wet cloth twice a day and washed it with cold water until it was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I made two special stitches according to the description of the Parable.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And that you begin the stitch with the thread from the outside, and push the needle from the inside to the outside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And so with the needle penetrating into the thread and in the length of all the body, leaving the end of the knot where you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate from the inside to the outside at the other extreme part of the member.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And so when you have made that penetration, then you make another penetration twice in the extreme part of the member from the inside to the outside; and leave the end of the knot where you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate from the inside to the outside at the other extreme part of the member.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make your penetration with that which makes that penetration in the knot at the extreme part of the member which is in the inside until all that penetrates.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	Then begin the stitch from that side, and pull the needle out at the extreme part which is in the inside of the member, and leave the thread with the knot; then bring the needle from the other side to the extreme part of the member; and take the needle out of that knot.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And make a cut here and there, and make another cut beside it, until you have cut all that which is in front according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the whole of this method of stitch is that you sew with the stitches which are on the skin, cutting all that which is in front according to the example; and making a complete cut on the other side.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second species of stitch is its own name, and this is according to its speech and by its description; that you sew with the second thread on which you add all the width to the other side in a convenient way for nature; and apply the extreme part of one side to the extreme part of the other side, and so it is made according to what I have told you.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Then take the needle to the extreme part of your thread at your next side, and make that penetration from the inside in two parts of the member; and then return the needle and make that penetration from the outside in two parts of the member.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	Then return those covers, and make that penetration from the inside of one part to the outside in another two parts of the member; and then return those covers, and make that penetration from the outside of one part to the inside in two other parts of the member which are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this method of stitching is better than the common stitch; and it is a stitch from which I have recalled the description.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Guilia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And they call it a stitch of the belly which is made with two needles; so you insert it in these two threads, and begin to make the penetration with the needle which comes from outside, and make that penetration in the other side according to the stitch of those which I have described; and so it is sewed.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	You should know that when there is a rupture in the middle part of the belly, then the stitch of this place is more difficult than that of the other parts of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	And the judgment of medicine for the plague is according to the other judgments.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	And the cause is that when you achieve the recent plague before it changes the air which affects that, and reduce the budel and sew it up; then put a powder on it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	If the air has already changed the plague, then put on it powder which is in your possession until it changes its color and the threads are firm; so that they are consolidated in the middle part; and so heal it as you cure the other plagues, until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have medicines, then put on it for a few days, because it starts to burn, and change the cloth twice a day; and so heal it as you teach it, until it is healed, because you do not need other medicine in these circumstances when the plagues are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the common plague will spread to the main members, then dip wool in wet oil of quality, or in rose water; and put it on the skin which is between the folds and leave it there.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if you feel pain or rot in the belly; because it is a sign that something is wrong there, then rub on it with black tar; and more so if the decay has reached the belly and has caused an opening inside it.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	You should know that the one who is thick in the belly is of a little healing; and that which is in thin bellies has more rot.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the belly which is called “gegunu” does not receive any healing of the plague which comes into it from all sides; and that is due to the great number of veins which are in it, and its size, which is small in those members, and its proximity to nature of nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if the cloth which you are using is infected with the plague, and you achieve it recently, then reduce it according to your description with which you reduce the bellies in the middle part.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if it is passed to that space and it has turned white or black, then you string up that thread on the area which is broken; so that blood flows from that place, because in that cloth are veins and arteries.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	Then you will cut it off again; and place two ends of the thread hanging down from the side of the space where the plague comes out, so that there is no attraction for it; because in that cloth are veins which come out and produce a bad smell of the plague.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembering the plagues when they happened in the belly.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a disruption happens in the belly and it is small, then it is possible that it will be restored in some men; because I have seen one who was struck by a lance in his belly from within; and that was the main plague of the right side of the belly, and the plague was old and had caused an opening; and it went out from it and produced a bad smell and heat.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Then, if I understood correctly, I continued with the treatment even though it was not yet completely healed because its essence is to sublimate that which heals and consolidates the place.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And I placed the patient on their back in such a position that the injury was raised above his navel; and I did not allow food or drink to enter by mouth, nor did I allow them to go out or exercise themselves by moving or drinking water; and I kept between them and the injury.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced people have said that when they cut into the hernia and it is small, then cover it in this way: you take two knots; and you adjust the two lips of the hernia and place one knot over those; so, when you put them on and tighten them with your hand, you cut off the top of him because it adheres and does not dissolve.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	Then place another knot next to the first one, and do not stop making knots according to the amount of hernia that is there.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	Then cut off that knot and sew the hernia; and if there is any remnant of the hernia left, then wrap it up so that the hernia is healed; and do not cause any harm to the patient at all.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is possible that the hernia is caused by a thin thread that comes out of the hernia's base from the animal, because it is like a sharp needle; and it is that you take the end of these hernia threads, and if one is very thin, and you wrap the end of it with a thread, and you insert that thread into needles and sew it up with it; and then reduce it to healing.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	This method of sewing with knots is only another way, a different way, of trust and hope.
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the hernia is large and wide, mainly because it is in a thin hernia; because then there is only one way to sublimate, not to heal completely.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	Of treatment for gout and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Do you know that any injury or abscess that is covered and gets older, and becomes a wound, not consolidated, always walks with its arm outstretched, and does not heal; then it is called a fistula in all members, and we call it gout.
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, according to its truth, is a deep, hard, white wound that does not hurt, and which is hollow; and therefore it is called "the pain of the fistula", that is, the ache.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And it is in men who are moist, which walks with its arm outstretched; and the moisture is absorbed in a few hours.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	Some of this moisture is evaporated, and it is little, and it is thick, and it is subtle.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already told you about the division of flesh, then when I said that wounds that are not healed or in raw flesh, it is not because of one of these nine things: because of bad circulation of blood; or because of evil; because between it and the lips there is hard flesh, which prevents the birth of flesh; or because it is thick; or because this wound itself is infectious and the matter that comes out of it is of a bad quality; or because the medicine used in its treatment is inappropriate in its effects; or because corruption spreads in the region, and therefore it is a pestilence; or because of the property of the region, for example, when a person goes to Zaragoza, where digestion of malicious substances is difficult, and it takes a long time to heal such wounds through nature's own properties; or because one has an ear of corn, or many bones.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	These are all the causes that I have mentioned, and they are explained in detail, as well as how to treat them through medicine in the division of flesh.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And so I told you about the treatment of a fistula, which is done by surgery with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	Do you know that fistulas occur in all parts of the body; because some of them reach the veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the cipha (spinal cord), or the bowel, or any of the sides of the ribs, or one of the joints composed of two bones joined together by cartilage; and they are similar to those that affect the main members and their neighbors.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And therefore those fistulas that occur in this way are of difficult healing; they do not respond to treatment or work, and ignorance is their consequence.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	If any of these fistulas is too deep to reach those places that are mentioned, and you wait and trust in the healing; and if you want to gain knowledge of them, then try to stretch or cut it, and if the fistula follows a course through surgery, and you examine it carefully.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is twisted, then investigate it with a thin needle, because a needle that rises and falls in weight is suitable for bending the twists of the fistula.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has become hard, it is not in your power to do any signs on it with a needle.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then clean the opening with a strong solution, because the moisture that you use to clean it will also go through the other openings and run off.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then ask carefully, according to which method you can recognize if there are any bones or nerves; and this fistula is distant or close to the surface, or it is a fistula with only one opening and it is over the whole body, from top to bottom; and if you want to examine it thoroughly, then remove it completely, taking care not to hurt yourself.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all these causes at the same time, then proceed with confidence to the treatment: and it is that you consider whether this fistula appears close to the surface of the flesh, or far from the joints; or if it is next to nerves, arteries, or veins; or any of the parts mentioned before.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then clean the fistula according to what I have told you about its treatment; and let that water flow through it, and from the flesh, and into the openings of the flesh; and let it be cured that which needs to be healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is very deep, and follows a course, then cut it as much as you can; and remove all of its corrupted flesh; and insert sharp instruments wrapped in strong medicine; and put those into the hollow of the fistula, which you have cut open.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	Then pour that medicine into the opening of the fistula, so that it corrupts all that is inside because of its sharp nature.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore that with what you have to make healthy flesh grow within the fistula, which needs to be healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by water, then you must cauterize it according to what we have described.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone; and you must investigate it and clean it according to what we have described; and if you do not stop it from affecting any vein, nerve, or main member, as we have mentioned before.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is discovered in your presence and it is dark and corroded; then cut off that piece of bone that is corrupted; and then heal that with water, which needs to be cured.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and walks with its arm outstretched, as it does when it is completely cured; then you know that you have not achieved the full eradication of corruption; and then examine it carefully and precisely again; and then restore that which has been damaged by the last strong force, and thus heal it.
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And if it is cured, then good; but if not, know that corruption lies far within the body, which cannot be reached, and so you have only to remove that.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the bone is corrupted, then it is small, or it is possible for you to reach that, then do so with fine tweezers, which need to be directed towards water.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully extract all of them, and do not leave any cause to your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if you have any cause of the moisture, and in their incision there is no fear or mistake, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are here, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to open the bones of your body, then pause over the water that can be reached, and leave that water within which is the flesh and ligaments, and keep the water from being hardened, and the section that you have made in your operation shall be forced.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	And so, if you fear, then pause over the trissat-oiled bed, or the Egyptian oil bed, or one of the green oils, because when those ligaments are being poured, and the bones are separated from them, and that attraction is being removed.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone, then such as of the back or of the hips or similar to those, and that water which is corrupted is only on the surface of it, then carefully cut off that blackness and corruption, and restore the water.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if that water which is corrupted is a great mass, and corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to stop up that water, and to cut all within that place where corruption has come, and then heal that which has become hardened.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you give this water to a man in his space so that he pauses it for example and helps your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	A young man of around 30 years old, to whom pain occurs in his testicles, and the separations of those are on the matter within the body up to the testes, and that matter is pus with great pus, and he does not have an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then he extended the time to that person because of the mistake of the doctors up to the moment when the pus became more serious, and it discharged its filthy matter, and his cure was postponed until the legs were swollen, and many holes were made in them which all bled and there was moisture from the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then many doctors treated him for two years, but he did not improve in that place, because I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the swelling of his legs and the flow of matter from those holes for a great length; and the man's body was completely swollen, and the color of it was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I put my hand into one of those holes and touched the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then I looked closely at all the holes, and I found that they came from all parts of the back.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I hid myself and cut into one of those holes where I found a piece of bone broken, and I removed that corruption, and it was already dry and corrupted and discolored; and another part of the back had been broken in which a piece had penetrated into the pelvis.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I cleaned that water that I had discovered and prepared the bone that had been discovered.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I recognized that it was not in the bone but that corruption which I had cut off and cleaned, and I had already removed it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I paused the restoration of the water with solidifying medicine for a long time, and it did not become hardened.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	Then I went back and discovered the bone again after the first discovery, and I continued to remove corruption from it.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	I cleaned that water which appeared after that corruption, and then I made a hole to heal it and restore it, but it was not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I discovered another space below it and did not stop cutting the small bone little by little and piercing the restoration of it, but it was not restored until I cut about a palm of it, and I extracted its marrow, and then I healed it with medicines, and it became hardened a little and was healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And there is no need for an operation on him and cutting his body except by the disposition of his freeness and his lack of tolerance and fear of death, because it occurs to him at all times due to excessive vomiting that causes fainting.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	So he was healed entirely, and there is nothing in the place of hard bone; and his virtue returned to him; and he did not change his behavior, nor did it cause any discomfort while walking or any other cause.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if it is an eminent bone in the place of the body that has been broken already, then you should know that you cut that second way: and that you take a ligament and strengthen it at the end of that eminent bone, and direct someone to extend that ligament; and pause that ligament with wool yarn that is fine from the first ligament; and then bring that ligament over the flesh that is next to the bone, and extend the end of it so that you can pull on the flesh of those parts, and you will discover the flesh over that place where you want to cut it so that the saw does not touch the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And he pauses firmly or table-like on the end of the bone, for when you make water it is not prohibited to cut the corrupted flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And you should know that the sawing is on the corrupted place little by little, because if it is in the concavity of the bone and does not appear in its appearance to the sense, and forces the other lock.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not eminent, then you should know that one end continues to the other, and corruption is in its place or in another part; then you discover all the flesh; and then you pause firmly or table-like on it, and then you saw at the end of that first part where the corruption is until it continues with the locking of the other part.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And let the sawing be in accordance with the place of corruption a little, as I have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, then you should know to cut that corrupted joint, and then saw the bone where it continues with the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in reason but in another cause.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the pectus of the chest or the neck, it is difficult; but you should know that if you ask about the corruption and how it appears to you, and you cut it, and then you form it as best as you can, and then correct it for you, when it does not cause any discomfort to the veins or nerves.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know that the incisions and sawing of these bones depend on their places, and their preparation, and the thickness of them, and their subtlety and size and smallness, and their hardness and their rarity; so that you prepare every type of operation with suitable instruments for that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you should know that this operation requires specific instruments of which you are ignorant; and if you have long study and understanding of the methods of this art, and witnesses of its failures, for then you will be familiar with them, all of which is required to do this operation.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I'll tell you at the end of this chapter the number of instruments that will be simple for you to use in your prohibition, which you will experience on other things.

E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And you should only use them when the heads of the joints are corroded or the large mouth is wide open.

E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the end of it is triangular with an acute point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	It is made of Indian steel, and its appearance is similar to that of razors, incisors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the extreme incising and the locking of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may be preserved or not, depending on the inherent cause or the extrinsic cause; if you treat that corruption with medicines and cure does not come about, or sometimes the corruption comes about without striking any cause, then incise that member within where the corruption occurs, so that the bad thing is removed by water from death or maliciousness which is a greater dispelling of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that person is that the member becomes black within where it has burned, or it is returned to its original state within that the corruption has not reached, or it has struck all the body; and therefore cauterize that member.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And in appearance, if the corruption is caused by some poisonous cause from a scorpion of the sea or a snake or a weasel, and similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in that end, then you incise that part and do not give space for the corruption to enter the whole body.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And if you hit that part, then you incise it from the edge of the fire, and do not give space for the corruption to enter where it reaches the fire of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if that part is hit, then you incise the arm within where it joins in the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if that corruption and again goes around the joint, then death occurs for the patient; and in this case, a quantity of virtue is administered.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And in appearance, if corruption appears on that foot instead of the other foot, then you incise it within one of the feet.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold of the slope of the foot, then you incise all the foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	Or if it strikes the groin within, then you incise the groin where it joins.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already struck the groin, then let there be only dismissal, and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the way of incising the member or sawing it is that you tighten the joint at the end where you want to incise, and strengthen another joint over the spot; and extend the ministry of a joint to the ends, and extend the other joint to them; and you separate the meat which is between two joints apart, and so it is incised or sawed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	It is better to pause the drape of meat from all parts in order that it does not touch the spot, and let the patient suffer a proper injury and an aposteme cauterize.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	Or if you hit flux of blood when working, then you cauterize the spot properly, or sprinkle some powder on it to tighten it; and return to your medication as soon as possible.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the infected member with a strong joint, and cure that within which is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that you take care of a man in his own foot, this mety who has accidentally struck it with fire that was assembled by fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first occurred in that foot's joint which extends to the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself for this other man who brought the cure to that member with the speed of his own life which was taking him from pain and from the heat of his own fire, and he incised that foot within the joint, and fire healed it.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	A long time ago, that corruption occurred in that man's foot while walking.
