E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then let blood be drawn with a long, large needle little by little; then draw out the blood according to the time or water, as much as you need; and then do the same for the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	Then cut off the thread and tighten the two veins with a moderate grip because the patient might die if they choke; and leave them inside, for the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the healing power of bloodletting from the veins is to relieve a small blister and pus on the mouth, corruption of the gums, and bad ulcers and cracks; and also to remove bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of bloodletting from those is that you cut the skin in front of your face, and tighten it with a cloth, and separate the lips of him; and look at the two veins which are on the right side of the lip, and the other which is on the left; and recognize each one according to its blackness, and this one is more because the two blood vessels are small black ones; then cut one with a sharp blade.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	Then if you have any doubt, leave it; and if you do not know which one is which, then go to the incision of the larger one, and of the manifestation of pus from them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	Then make the incision of the two veins that are on the lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	And always cut deeper than you need to; and always go deep with the incision of those two veins.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	And from the two veins that are on the tongue, half an inch of bloodletting is enough for headaches, and for a pre-fever that is in the throat, and for ancient diseases of the mouth.

And the quality of bloodletting from those is that you follow the tongue between your hands before the sun comes out; and raise the tongue of him, and look at the two veins on either side, and their color changes to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	Then bloodlet one of them; and be careful that you do not draw the blood out of them too much, because those are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are bloodletting in the neck are those from which blood is usually drawn in all people; and the bloodletting from them is done with two methods, or by inserting a needle with care or by cutting with a knife and applying it to the wound, if there is any, and this is its form.
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And the former one is that it is done by section, and from those special thin ones according to the width of the veins and according to their constriction.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Method for cutting the skin with a knife in a V-shape, leaving two ends.
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	And the third one is that it is done by opening the skin of the vein with care, and this is done to reveal large veins, and also those that contain thick blood; and these ones are removed in a different way than those.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of olive bloodletting:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this type of bloodletting is of lesser duration and more subtle in its effect; it is suitable for bloodletting from small veins that contain mild black bile.

Then it should be strengthened with a string half-way on the joint, and then it should be severed according to the small cross, not longitudinallly or according to its length.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And be wide open and your surgery should be done at the joint of the hand a little bit.

Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the summer days, then you are excused from immersing the hand in water, and the time of the month is paused when the urine flows into water in winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the surgery of this vein is more safe than that of all the others, because there are no pulsatile veins or nerves.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the surgery of the little finger on the right hand is done to the hernia in the belly.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of the surgery is that you tighten the hand with a rope or your own, because you have immersed it in water until the vein swells and is clearly visible; then you should sever it according to the cross, and if you cut it from all sides it will not be seen there.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And preserve that you do not cut off the hand after surgery, because there are nerves of those denuded muscles.

E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the type of surgery for the vein is done to the hernias that are in the side of the body, as they are also hernias of the mother, and with the retention of menstruation, and with the hernias of the ribs and the breasts, and their similarity to those hernias.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the surgery is that the patient puts his hand in water until a vein appears clearly; and he places a strip on the joint of the hand; and the place of the vein should be clearly marked, and from there it should branch out into the face of the hand like branches.

And if you sever the vein on the face of the hand, then you should guard yourself from the nerves that run under it on the face of the hand; and do your surgery according to the cross, as if you were cutting it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And be careful with the surgery.

And if the person who performs the surgery makes a mistake in the first cut, then he repeats it again a little bit because the place is marked; and you do not fear that it will be bad, but you should guard yourself from the nerves there as well, for what we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	Then do the same for the other side in reverse.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And from the sciatic vein, the place there as we said is marked by removing the skin from the side of the hip.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the surgery for the arm is done with pain when it is caused by the pain.

And the quality of the surgery is that the patient goes into a bath, and he speeds up and tightens his belt on the hip from the side with four holes in a long and thin piece of rope, because it does not appear otherwise except by water.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	Then when it appears, then you should sever it with the second cut, which is on your side and according to the cross, and it is better; or you can cut it by cutting it or you can make a cut, because the place is marked.

And the vein is in a place where it is difficult to find; and if you feel the pulse of that vein, and it does not appear clearly, then sever any part of it, and that which appears on the two sides of the ear and the ring finger.

De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of windiness and of the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Of windiness by means of corns, or of earwax, or of veal.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And windiness is caused by two methods: one is the cutting and extraction of urine, and the other is windiness by means of cutting.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this windiness caused by cutting is according to two methods, because it is either made by fire or cut with it.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the places from which windiness is administered by cutting and extracting urine are twelve parts of the body, of which one is in the back of the neck, and it is the last division of the head; and the middle part of the jaw on the left side; and the lower part of the tongue next to the mouth; and two spatulas; and the sides of the cheeks; and the two chins, and they are at the end of the chin; and two fires, and they are from the two arms; and two knots; and two muscles.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And windiness does not extract urine from the small veins in the flesh, and it does not stop the flow of urine until the whole body is emptied; but windiness is made by fire or cut with it, because it is a kind of hernias that are caused by a full bladder, and this is what makes the surgery possible, or it stops windiness by stopping the flow of urine.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity forces windiness by a hernia or continuously, then let it be urinated in the beginning of the meal and at its end, and in the middle part of it; and in half of the time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	And this cause is because men have urine in their bladders, and they do not feel thirsty until the whole bladder is filled with urine; and this causes windiness by fire or cutting it, because it is a kind of hernias that are caused by a full bladder, and this is what makes the surgery possible, or it stops windiness by stopping the flow of urine, and this is what causes the pain in the head and in the hair; and this is what causes darkness in the eyes and in the forehead, and sadness and confusion in the mouth; and this is what causes the blurring of the sight and the dimness of the vision, and this is what causes the person to taste urine in his mouth, or that the tongue becomes inflamed and spits out urine; and this is what causes the sleeping to multiply, and this is what causes men to sleep with a full bladder, and to be wet by it, and cold and rain, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And when, by some cause of those, and particularly if it is in the third or middle part of the month, then I command that ventilation be done before two or three hours have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventilation of the nape is that when it supports gravity on the head and goes down into the grooves; but more so that all the body be appropriately evacuated.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	This ventilation is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic.

E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of sacrifice in which is the depth of the line only.

Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	May the cuts that are to be made be those that are stopped on the flesh, and over the wound and podagra, and over the navel, in the places of the joints, and the cutting of the navel string; for these members do not suffer from being cut.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And do not desire that from those but an attraction of pain of a member, so then stop a wound on the flesh, and over the wound and podagra, and over the navel, in the places of the joints, and cutting the navel string; and use that so that it is dissolved a sharp wind that rubs the member, and then stop over the belly and the navel, for that member becomes hardened and bleeds; because it resolves a wound.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And is stopped on the cheeks when it happens to their operation or pox, because by virtue of strong attraction light operation drives away the pox from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And seems when stopped on the flesh and navel a wound resolves in those that are enclosed.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	These winds are given only with juice, and some are given with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And some wounds are given full of running water in the navels.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And that water is to fill the wound and be large, or is water in which herbs have been boiled; then use it.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of wound given with fire: its size is two fingers wide, depending on how we have formed it; and the quantity of the liquid is half a palm, and is in the center, the amount that enters into it a needle; and the hole is small according to the quantity that enters into it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let be made of rose water or lemon, with large edges, lion, gooseberry and raspberry; so that it does not harm the member due to its position.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And is given, at the edge of the foot, a transverse piece of rose or iron, on which is stopped a candle by fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this wind is much greater than that which we have described; and the small one of those, according to the navels and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the winds of young people are different from the winds of old people and those of big bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of stopping this wind with fire on the member is that he extends the ax to fire with wood properly in front of a small candle of wax, and stops it on the middle edge of the foot of the transverse piece of the axe in its middle place of the wound, so that the fire burns the whole body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then stop it on the member of the patient, and the thread on which we have spoken, unless when we have the wounds, do not want to stop that thread, but let the vapor run over that thread; then the wound is resolved as if dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And light the fire according to its way, and repeat it if you do not want that fire.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	May a wound that is given in the navel of the patient, with water, not having a transverse piece or thread, and is not given except it be filled with water, and is stopped on the member only.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	This is the form of it: And this wind, how much greater it is, so much better; because it receives a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Sanguineous wounds are not given on motor members, but on the members on which it is not possible to place wind, because of their smallness, or because they do not have hair, or because they are in the form of a nose and look like them; or on naked member made of flesh, when the thread looks like them.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found if there are any sanguinous wounds that are in the clean waters of the world.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And let them be washed the day and night in two clean waters unless they are famished, and that does not harm any cause in the belly of those; and let the body be emptied at the beginning of cauterization and venereation, and let them be scrubbed on the member of the patient until it turns red; and then stop it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled up.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible juice from the wound, it is much better.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	Then, if not, wash the place with wine and then pour on water, and squeeze it out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the wound is prolonged in the member, close it with a piece of flesh, and if there is a residue, then stop it with a bandage; so that it does not become infected.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the wound is multiplied, then dust on it three times a day, or apply to it, and seem like them of the stinging causes, unless the wound is cleaned; or stop it with the roots of the beans, and wash it, so that the beans stick to the wound, and the wound is cleaned.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And when necessary, a repetition of the wound, as often as possible change those who suck blood.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the sanguineous wounds are prohibited by suspension, then wash the place with fresh blood or put a needle in the places unless it stings; and then stop them, because those who feel any pain immediately stop them.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want to make them fall, dust on those a little of dried aloe, or salt, or ash, and wash it often.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the treatment of third-degree burns: by restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is necessary in the art of medicine; and it is the treatment of fractures and accidental dislocations of the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that this chapter speaks of the foolish doctors and the vulgar ones and those who at no time looked at the free books of the Ancients or read a letter of them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason it is necessary that the method of the scientists in our land is reserved; and I have not forgotten it in anything, but have studied their books in length and understood them, unless I drew out the science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then he began to experiment and study in my youth.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described this in this chapter all that concerns my science and upon which is based my experiment; for it has added to the length of my life, because it has released me from occupation with elongation; and has renewed life in me at the end of renewal; and has shown me in the end of declaration; and I have formed in it a variety of shapes of the instruments that are used in it, except by addition of declaration, as I have made it in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter first.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	First chapter: Great and various are the causes of fractures of the bones; those on which the following preposition is necessary before we begin to remark on the members that are broken, and of different kinds.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	And therefore, let us say in the proem of this chapter the great principles of the speech; and the chapters that are to be understood by the artisan on the truth of those; so that you and those who are prompters to learn this noble art from you and others than can teach it.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And I say that when it happens to any fracture or dislocation or twist or impingement, then cover that you are cauterizing at the beginning with bloodletting or laying them down, or all together, if there is no cause to prohibit, so also with a healing of virtue, or it is that which has happened to him, or he is in decrepitude, or it is time for a violent heat, or a violent cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	Then put him on his own food of herbs and meat of birds and crabapples; and forbid coarse meat and filling himself with food and all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are sure that there is no pus in cauterization, and if you do not fear a flow of matter into the limb.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	Then return the patient to his first position with him who usually takes care of him.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the broken bone begins to be restored, then cover that the patient is being fed with nutritious foods of food and gross and heavy ones in which there is viscosity, so also with foods made from wheat cooked in water, and rice, and cabbages, and feet, and bellies of cows, and geese, and fresh milk, and large and similar to those, and this regime is made a coagulation of the fracture slightly and honey.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you know that the bones break when they are in men who are in their first youth and in decrepitude, it is not possible that they are continued and consolidated according to their nature by the drying up of the limbs of them.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature at all times by the drying up of those limbs, and they are continued and consolidated which are of them in the end of the leniency, so also with the bones of small children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But nature adjusts and amends on the broken bone from the very beginning any apparent cause of glut that adheres and strengthens that within which is consolidated and bound together, until it comes to the end of strength and firmness, so also with fire at the beginning, until there is no cause to prohibit it from its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you pause the patient's food, foods in which there is gravity and viscosity and grossness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Diversity of fracture according to diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you know that the varieties of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the spine is different from a fracture of the head; and a fracture of the foot is different from a fracture of the leg; and similarly all the other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I remember with care of all the varieties of fracture, separated in his own chapter from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Diversity of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the varieties of fracture of the bone in itself are diverse; for it is made a curved fracture and another that happens in its stars; and some are made by the length of the bone: and they are the fractures of the skull and the temples and the additions, whether they proceed or do not proceed, also when it is made in the pain when it is prepared to write, and its fracture with a plague and disruption in the head, and its small fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And all this variety is made by nature itself in the restoration of him according to what will come; let us remember it separately according to its places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Diversity of fracture of the bone.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this is recognized a fracture of the bone: it is tortuosity of it, and from it eminence and appearance of it to the sense, and not from it when you press that one with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore, when it is not in the apparent place of tortuosity nor is it made by this, then do not do any touch to the patient when you agitate the bone, and if he does not feel great pain, then there is no fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	And while it is possible that it is tortuosity or a small fracture, then do not cover that you press that one with your hand and compress all of them together; and pause the medicines of which you have memory appropriately at that moment that conveys to the place; and make it straight by subtle strictness.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you know that the place when it is curved and does not split into two or another that happens in his satagia, if it is re-made all at once from its own beginning, then begin from your own hour to correct it while you are making him a bloodletting cautery.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if you are making him a bloodletting cautery, then leave that one for several days until the bloodletting ceases; and place it according to each way that you can of levitation and invention.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you know that the restoration of him and the opening up of him is more painful than the fracture of the bone in which this happens to the satagia.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And place it according to what will come, when you remember him.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if there are two satagies in the bone, then it is necessary to extend this broken member of two parts, if it is the arm or the leg; or at your hand if the member is small; or at two strings or at a string and at your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And be your position at which you place the limb extended as it is according to its natural figure, while these parts are extended from the broken limb, then know that you must make a cut for returning those additions by invention and in each way that you can place them in their places.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care according to your strength that it does not happen to the patient by your operation or injury; and proceed according to your own power that you apply one bone to another in its company according to its best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And place that one with your hand at that moment appropriately, and if there is any other cause, correct it and place it according to the quantity of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And do violent extension and compression, as well as foolish movements that happen in the member when this is made, so also with a violent heat of the limb, as if it were a cause of bloodletting by its operation, or a cause of pain in the member when it has happened to him.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And place it according to its connection and its operation and strictness of that limb, and rest and quietness; tell the patient about this and do not make him move that one in the hour of his vigils and his sleep, and watch his revolution and agitation, and know all his movements at all times with your own virtue; and wait until it is certain that the position of the limb is proper to him, so that pain does not happen to him; and keep in mind that when the position of it is changed, then do not make that member move too much by its connection with that one, and place it according to that one's position so that the member does not break when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the strictness of the limb is what I recommend; so that you know that broken members are diverse in their smallness and size and in the form of them.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And those that are small, as the arm and the foot, so also with a soft skin. And when it is warm, then do not cover that one with a heavy cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	And those that are large, as the shoulder or the back, then cover that one with a skin that is long and hard; for the skin that is soft connects the large member and strengthens it by its whole part with strictness, so that it does not enter into a spot of trouble.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And begin your operation with care on the patient, pause it carefully according to that one, and place it in its place of fracture with three coverings or four according to the limb, and strengthen your hand at all times.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	Then bring him up to where he is most comfortable, and tighten him there so that his pain does not cause him discomfort.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then extend him a little more in the wrapping of the broken place, and soften the tightness little by little, until you get from the place a great extension.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And take another object and wrap that other cloth over the place three times in the wrapping, and bring the wraps to where he is most comfortable from the fracture; and your operation on the tightness of the wrapping and softening of that second one as we said in the first wrapping.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Then pause between the wraps of stopa lion or cloth so that the curvature of the fracture is engaged in it, if there is a curvature; and if not, do not pause for any reason.

And let the wires be of moderate thickness and soft, and if they are thick, so much the better; but if they are too thick, so much the worse, for to cut the tightness equally is a great mistake when it is done by cutting with sharp-edged instruments.

Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are different, and the causes are distinct, because some fractures are caused by a blow from a spear or other sharp object, and the blow breaks the bone completely inside the skin, leaving it exposed, so this type of fracture is called an ascial fracture; or the spear pierces a part of the bone, and it pierces the flesh and does not go deeper than the back of it; and this type of fracture is called an absolute elevation.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the plague of these two types of fractures is great or small, and the fracture that is contracting or narrowing; and its cause is a blow with a spear or a hard object striking on the head, and they resemble each other.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca. E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And this is a fracture that is caused by a hard object or a blow from the side, and it enters some of the bone's parts, and it is made in the concave place, as if it happens to the tendons when they are struck by their blows and they break into the parts inside them.

More in the treatment of fractures, from the beginning, consider the accidents of the patient, and if you see through the accidents that mean danger by clear sign over pain, as if vomiting from cholera, and its extension, and loss of reason, and fainting, and high fever, and the appearance of gas in their breath, and the smell of it, and similar things to those accidents in the major situations, it is not treated unless it is healed.

E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if there is a small piece of bone that is broken and loose, take it out with ease as you would with the tools; then clean the wound with lime and water.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another way of doing the operation is by cutting off, far from pain, which is what Guilia and Lausa did with great skill; and this is how it goes: it is necessary that you begin to uncover the break in the bone where the fracture is more violent and visible, so that when you have uncovered that part and have paused, you will have reached the end of this incisor slowly and gently, which is the shape:
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the round break is sharp and does not touch any part, and the acute break is in two pieces of length, sometimes forward, so that the round break is fitted to the body, with its acute edge on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.	And hit it with the incisor on one edge of a small piece, so that you cut all the bone easily like this, and if there is any danger in this way, which no one knows, or if it is a deadly poison; certainly, and if it was sleeping.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	If it should happen that there is a part of the body attached to the bone in some place, cut it with ease with this incisor, because it will be easily removed from the body, lest there be any danger or pain.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	And if the bone fracture does not penetrate into the body, and what is broken is on the surface of the bone, and there are small and sharp edges, then when you remove those edges with sharp needles, prepare a number of them of various sizes so that you can administer them in all possible ways; use the ones most convenient to you at each place, and the most appropriate for those who are suffering from pain.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And when you administer the needle with a broad point at the beginning of the procedure, use the sharpest one; and then continue using them in succession until you reach the end of giving the injection, using the sharpest ones first.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	For any small hairline fractures or subtle breaks, administer care according to the course of treatment that you have decided upon.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	This is why they do not agree on all points in that art.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And he writes about these large fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the pannicle is rectangular when you cut off the bone, then take a piece of cloth according to the amount of wound, and dip it in rose oil; place that over the orifice of the wound; and then take another piece of cloth, folded or triple, and dip it in vinegar and rose oil, and place that over the first cloth; and then administer the ointment in a thin layer as much as the wound requires.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	Let the wound heal with this treatment for a day or two until you are sure that there will be no suppuration; and then clean it and administer medicines that are not necessary to dry it out, such as flour of erysipelas and powder of endives and dandelion, and similar things.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	This is because you must spray these medicines on the wound as much as they are dry; and generally, administer all medicines in a thin liquid form so that they do not stick.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Keep in mind that your cure should be clean; and do not use something like a balm in which the wound becomes infected; nor do you add virulence to it; because when it is applied to the pannicle of the skull, it corrupts it and harms it, and causes evil on the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And you cause harm to the skull when it is removed from the body, more so when the cure for it is not completed; and if you consider this carefully, you will see that all of these things are dangerous in themselves.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas .iii., e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If you do not cause harm from the medicine itself, but rather from the benefit of that medicine, then take a piece of honey and some rose oil; and put them in a cloth; and place that over the skull; and then heal it with the spices of treatment as much as it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the Restoration of the Nose When It is Broken
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You know that the nose is not broken from two separate pieces of cartilage, or one of those small bones, because it has only bone; and there is no fracture, but rather a bump and some curvature and deformation.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	But if one of the two pieces is broken, then you must push the small bone into its place inside the nose, and the other piece outside, so that the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	Do it easily for yourself, and be careful not to harm the patient with your procedure on their nose.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	If the fracture is in the upper most part of the nose, and it does not reach that bone, then make it equal to the end of the ridge where it is a little thin.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	If the fracture is in two pieces, then you make the nose look like that.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Rest and do not do anything to the nose on the first day of the fracture, if possible; otherwise, by the seventh day, take a rest from work with regard to suppuration.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert a piece of cloth into the end of the nose, if the fracture is in one part, or two pieces, and make it the width of the nose ridge by adding as much as it needs to fill that ridge.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And I say some of the old restoratives that the calve is wrapped in a bandage, and they are changed every day, but I have not seen it; provided that the calve is wrapped in album from beef suet mixed with powder; and then let it rest until the bone has hardened and the cartilage has been strengthened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	Some are wrapped in the nose, instead of calve, lest they be closed by a bandage wrapped too tightly around the nose; and that it is already broken from the most violent fracture, and that the patient may not be forbidden to breathe.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This is not necessary for you; and if you want to, make it one piece, and if you want to, make two pieces.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if there is another suppuration, insert the nose with a cerat in vinegar and rose oil, or with a cotton-wool plug; or with diaquelone.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	But if there is no suppuration, then you insert it outside with flour of erysipelas and powder of endives in beef suet; and then place it over the nose so that it does not stick to anything.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	If the bones of the nose are broken or crushed, then cut them apart and remove those with instruments that suit them; and then sew up the wound, treating that which is infected and solidifying it and applying plasters as necessary.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if plague occurs inside the nose, then you must treat that with calamine and administer lead cathartics so that it is completely cured.
Capitol .iiii.	Chapter .iiii.
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	Restoring the jaw when it is dislocated.
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and the fracture is not accompanied by plague, regard if it is out of place only slightly and is not bent or twisted inside, then its recovery will be easy.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, you should introduce the little finger of your left hand into the mouth of the patient; and likewise, if the fracture is on the left side, then insert the little finger of your right hand; and gently push the fracture out of place with the other hand, holding it in position with that of the injured side; do this carefully and skillfully.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the jaw fracture has separated into two pieces, then you must administer extension of two parts according to their position so that the alignment is possible.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a concussion of the teeth, then strengthen those which you hope will endure with gold, silver, or cedar; and place wax on the broken jaw, and place a double cloth over it, and carefully place a single thread along its length; and place a weight on it according to whether it is suitable for binding and applying it, so that it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And order the patient to rest and be calm, and provide him with sour drinks.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you suspect that the shape has been altered in some way, then you shall cover it and leave it for three days; and then correct what has been distorted with dust of mulberry, chalk, or flour of cypress, because you will have removed the wax from it, and place wool over the plaster.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then, once it is settled and adjusted, leave it, that you do not disturb it until it has healed completely and strengthened the fracture; for if the fracture remains untreated for three weeks, it will be difficult to heal.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if any other fever occurs, then administer calamine to it that has been seen in the patient's sweat before it is healed, and remove the puss from it.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is infected, then consider whether it is a small piece of bone or a large one, then you shall prepare those that are large with an instrument that suits them; and administer water to remove any of those on the instruments.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the wound from the plague is narrow, then you shall increase it with a scalpel according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then, once you have removed those that are large, and if any remain, then patch them up with calamine so that they are healed; and if any puss remains, place it under a plaster so that it is healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter.v.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	Restoring the fork when it is dislocated.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	The bones of the fork are broken in one of three ways when the fracture is made from the front at the edge of the muscle.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	It may be broken, separated, or separated into two pieces that do not cause any pain; and it is easy to restore it; or it may cause pain in some parts of the fork; and its restoration is difficult; or if the fracture is infected.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And the operation in that, when the fracture is infected, is that you present two assistants, so that one holds the fork and fixes it, and the other extends the blood vessel at the break.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then bring the fracture together with the fingers so that it takes its natural shape, and not in its little prominence or concave shape.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you have a cold sweat, then pause the stinging of the patient' hand with a cloth or wool, and make the size larger or smaller according to your need; and extend and raise the fork, and fix it with a bandage so that it takes its correct shape.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot fix the extremities of the fork to the outside parts, because it comes into contact with the neck, then the patient should be placed on his back; and place a cushion under his head, and position a cloth half the size in front of him.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	And the assistant presses the muscle in front of where the bones of the fork are raised so that they are above the neck; and then you correct the fracture and bring it together with the fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel pain in the fork or it is difficult to move, then cut those out and remove them easily.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is stuck in the bone, then you shall use a sharp instrument from your tools that you have placed in water; for you have left the fork alone; and this is the shape of the instrument:
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is like a horn from which this is the shape of the concave; and its size according to the water that you have provided for it, according to the size of the bone or the lack of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Then the length of the fork should be as it is for you to operate on; and there should be two ends, one wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the pain of the plague that you have cut out from the bone is wide, and you are sure that it is a puss, then you shall join the two edges of the wound with a stitch.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is little, or you fear puss, then you shall use cloth and powder according to the quantity of the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if any pain occurs, then pour wine vinegar and rosewater onto it, and place a cloth on it.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	Then the stricture of the bone when it is infected and separated, is that you patch it with flour of mulberry applied with egg white, and place a cloth on it; and then you shall use an iron hook, which is long and sharp, so that it reaches the edge of the fracture, if necessary, and torches the skin from it; and then apply powder to the wound.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And all of this is to prevent the fracture from opening; and so that you may see the patient every day, if the bandage is wet or unfastened, then you shall correct what has been distorted and tighten the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	And then place the patient to sleep on his neck, and leave the stinging of the neck slightly apart; so that the support of the neck is raised above the neck, and thus raise the fracture of the fork at the edge of the muscle; or let it rest against the neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And you shall not remove the bandage if there is no pain in it immediately or puss, until twelve days have passed.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	And if he is seen to have a feverish face, then apply the plaster again and tighten it and restore that which has been broken; let rest until it has been healed and the fracture has been clotched.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And if he is strengthened and comforted according to the season in 28 days, and in some men it takes a longer time for that;
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	Of the Restoration of the Fracture of the Shoulder-blade.
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The spatula is broken in the place of the shoulder, and not broken from the shoulder, but only the edges are broken.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And when it is broken in the middle, and not known by touch, then according to the shape of the fracture prepare it and reduce it according to the natural figure in all ways; by means of which it can be done with ease.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then sprinkle over the place a powder of wheat flour and stop it with honey; and place over it a cloth that is doubled, and place on it a thin board according to the quantity of the spatula, or less.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	Or if in some places the place of the spatula is hollow, then you fill that hollow with honey; and place the board according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then tighten it with a long hammer, and fasten the board so that it is not shaken from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the joint every day; and wherever it is soft, tie it again, and tighten the board if it is shifted from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	Then pull the patient onto his back.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula is restored in 20 days or in 25.
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And when that number is completed, then you dissolve the joint, and that you know for certain that it is of the bones from which it did not break; nor did its dissolution cause any pain.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you cut the place of the bone and leave it with astringent; then you split it open, and stop it up; and do according to what has been said in the fracture of the clavicle by apothecaries' poultice if this occurs here.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	Of the Restoration of the Fracture of the Foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	The foot, in some cases, is broken in the middle and then healed within; but the extremities of it are sometimes dislocated and broken.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And of the accidents of the foot when it is broken in the middle, that it tilts towards the inside and causes great pain, difficulty in walking, coughing, hard breathing, and vomiting; and is declared in the cavity of the bone that has been broken, and does not conceal itself from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient be laid on his back, and a cushion placed between his thighs; and press the muscles of it, and adjust the ribs of it to the sides of two ribs, and make a point carefully in the operation of it and in the adjustment according to all ways that can be done so as to bring back the figure of the bone according to what can be done, until the figure of the bone is returned according to what has been said.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then place the plaster and straw over it, and a board of thin wood placed under it; and tighten that which is on the shoulder, so as not to be moved; and consider the tightening every hour, and when it has become soft, tighten it again.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	And if necessity compels you to remove the plaster from that part for any reason, or because of pain, or pus, which occurs in that place, then you cut and remove it, and correct that part by means of healing; and return the plaster to its place, if it has been removed a little way by water; and tighten that which is on it until it is healed.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	Of the Restoration of the Ribs When They are Broken.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.
