Then pause pressure on the limb so that the pressure brings food to him, or continuous moisture from him, so that the food flows and returns to its natural form.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter.XXII.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	Of the cure of broken bones, when they are restored by twisting and the operation of them is prohibited from him when it covers.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When the already restored limb happens to be deformed and to have a knotted shape, and it is due to the limb's lack of its usual function; however, the limb does not prohibit its natural operation, then do not take the words of one who exists that such a limb was newly knotted.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	However, there are already some foolish medicines and restorative remedies that have been done to him in our land; and this operation is very evil, losing the sign of which is deadly.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	However, if the claudication and nodulation are recent, then they should be moistened with water in which herbs that soften them are boiled; as well as leaves of arnica and yarrow, and similar things to those; or, if it is a paste of soft herbs, well-prepared, or if it is a poultice made with the broth of garlic, and applied with it; or, if grass-fat figues are boiled and triturated, and applied with fennel seed; or, if they are fresh figues that are boiled and triturated, and applied to them.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	And some times it is dissolved with slow friction that is moistened and applied to the most wet, and is administered limb motion at all times.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	However, if the twisting has already begun at the front and is strong, and it becomes a problem and causes the need for treatment with iron; then do not take the words of one who exists that such a limb was newly twisted. However, if it is twisted slightly at the front and is no longer twisted; then take care to remove all excess of nodulation from that limb using very fine instruments, and administer it with ease and attention.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter.XXXIII.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of talking in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is very much of one of the joints of the limb, by which it is prohibited from moving, and the shape of the limb is changed, and great pain and damage comes to the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when you happen to have a dislocation, then immediately cut it so that it is reduced, and do not delay reducing it; because if it is delayed, the limb becomes putrefied and difficult for it to be reduced.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And therefore do not stand or sit up during the apotheosis; because visible muscles bring about spasms and pains in the body.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	However, when it happens to you, then take care that you hide the limb from the flabotomy, and allow it to rest until the apotheosis has passed; and take care that the limb is moistened with water and oil, and reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole limb be cured with water from which the memory will come back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the chapters on dislocation according to which follows a fracture; from the upper part of the body to the lower part.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter.XXIV.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	So dislocated the two jaws if they are not tensed by little movement, and are slightly softened; or so dislocated by entire dislocation and complete, so that they are softened at the joint's start, before the saliva leaves the patient's mouth, and his tongue is wrapped in its words.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	However, when the dislocation of him is little, then in most cases it returns by itself because there is a little cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	However, if the dislocation is entire and complete, then it should be reduced slowly, and not delayed at all.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And it is that the minister has the head of the patient, and inserts it in the mouth of him at the part where the dislocation is inside the mouth, if the dislocation is from one side; or he inserts the two sides together, if the dislocation is from both sides, and the others are outside where they belong; and orders the patient to cease his jaw and perform those motions that can; and he wraps the jaw and ties it up, so that it returns to its place.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction of him is difficult, and more so if both of the jaws are completely dislocated, then administer vaporization with water and oil; so that the reduction of both is easy, and do not delay reducing both at all, for I have already said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And therefore, when you return and are wrapped up, and the mouth of the patient is closed and not softened, then pause on those dusts of cloth with a cotton ball, and make it with wax and rosin; and do so with ease on soft limbs.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And let the patient sleep on his two sides, and his head be between two pillows, so that he does not sniffle on either side; and do not force him to drink anything; and have his food be forbidden meat, so that when the pains return and the jaws are locked, then sniffle what you want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And let it be administered with ease, and do not work on the appearance of the mouth while eating or drinking or speaking; so that the jaw is locked and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if the reduction of two jaws is difficult when they are dislocated at any time and not reduced to their places, then immediately take care that visible muscles appear; and great pain and a sudden fever come, and strongly contract the abdomen of the patient, and suddenly vomit pure blood.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see this, then know that it is a waste of time; and take note of the days when it happens to him.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter.XXV.
De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	Of reducing the dislocation of the fibula and the end of the muscle.
Furcula no es dislocada del latz dedintz per la sua continuacio am le pietz; e alcunas veguadas es dislocada a la partida defora, e aquo es declarat al sentiment.	The fibula is not dislocated from the leg' end because of its continuity with the foot; and some times it is dislocated from the front, and then pain is felt.
E la restauracio de lu es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos e extenda les sieus brasses.	And the restoration of him is that the patient plays with his two sides and spreads his arms.
E aprop coarta le loc am la tua palma am fort coartacio, quar ela retornara.	Then tighten the joint with your hand with a firm tightening, because it will return.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre e pulvils e strenh aquela.	Then pause over that paste and dusts, and strengthen it.
Mays la extremitat de aquel que siec le coyde e·s continuat am aquel, no es dislocada en alcun dia; lahoras cove que sia reduzida e engualhada segon que havem dit e segon que es a tu aparelhat.	However, the end of that which secures it and is continuous with it, is never dislocated in any day; then should be reduced and wrapped up according to what I have said, and according to your custom.
E aprop pausa sobre aquela emplastre, e pulvils, e extrictura, e comanda al malaute adherir a trenquilitat e a repaus entro que sia sanat.	And place it on that plaster, and powder, and tighten up, and order the patient to remain calm and quiet until it is healed.
E am aquesta meteyssa curacio es reduzida la extremita del muscle quan es separada del sieu loc.	And this injection cure reduces the extremity of the muscle when it is separated from its place.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter .xxvi.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the Reduction of Muscular Dislocation.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	Know that the muscle is not dislocated except in three ways, one of which is that it is dislocated from the starting point of the tendine to the starting point of the tendon.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is that it is dislocated from the starting point of the muscle, and then it comes off; and it is not dislocated from the back through the shoulder, nor from the front through the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And mostly it is dislocated and comes off from the starting point of the tendine on the sides, and mostly in those who are thin-skinned, it comes off with difficulty; but in those where there is much flesh, it is easily dislocated.
E fort leu accideys ad alcus homes percussio o cazement, e le muscle de lu es apostemat de apostema caut, e es cujat per aquo que ja sia dislocat.	And a strong blow happens to certain men by percussion or impact, and the muscle of them is torn from tore, and is recognized by the one who has already been dislocated.
Adonc cove que tu sproes aquo entro que estias sobre-sertetut de lu, e lahoras procesiscas en la curacio de lu.	Then tell me that you are not sure about this because you were on top of him, and then proceed with the cure for him.
E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And the dislocation of it is recognized when it is on the sides away from the tendon; so that you distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the other, because you can tell them apart very clearly; and you touch the back of the muscle with your finger, so that a sound comes out like a whistle, and the patient cannot reduce his hand to his ear, nor make that movement.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated from below or above, and you feel a clear touch, and it does not hide itself.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And of this dislocation there is a little reduction when it is fresh and the patient is a child.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the minister raises the hand to its starting point; and he places the strings on either side of the tendon, and raises the joint with strength at its place, and the minister raises the hand, and extends it in front of him; and then he places those on either side because it returns with difficulty.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	But if by this water it does not return, and only from the beginning that the dislocation has happened, then when the patient is bathed in warm water and massaged with liniments so that they become soft and smooth as if their hair were cut with a razor, and fenugrec and melilot are added to the water, and it is administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Then the patient is to be put on his back and held in position with a strap that goes from his shoulder to his hip, waiting for the hair to grow between the tension and tightness, and then the doctor places his foot on the spine, and raises the joint with strength, and the minister holds the patient's head so that it does not move towards the sides, because that moment returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you want, reduce this second way: and it is that you have another man present who is longer than the patient, and he stands on the side of him, and inserts his hand under the tendon from behind, and raises the tendon of the patient up to its starting point while the patient is suspended in the air, and another minister holds the patient's head so that it does not turn towards the sides, for thus the patient returns to its place.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	But if the patient is very ill, then when you know that another cause is responsible for his suspension, so that this one returns because the dislocation comes back quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And it is reduced and another way: that a long pole with a round top, like a staff of mortar, that is neither too thick nor too thin, is placed behind the patient; because it is placed on the top of the staff, and the patient stands according to its length, and his hands are extended towards the sides with strength, because the joint returns to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if the reduction of it is difficult for all the reasons we have mentioned, then use this cure: and that you take a pole whose length is equal to two arms, and whose height is four times the distance between the shoulder and the elbow, and whose thickness is reduced at the top of the tendon according to this figure:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then place it on the top with a round staff, like a staff of leather, so that the pole does not slip from the patient's hand.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then the staff is placed behind the tendon of the patient, and the hand or arm is extended towards the sides with strength, until it reaches the starting point, and the staff is held tight by the assistant and the arm and the tip of the hand.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And then the arm is placed on a step according to its height, and the hand is extended towards the sides, and the other side is suspended from the other part, because the joint returns quickly.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And when the instrument is completed according to each of your possible methods, and you pause behind the tendon with a rope that reaches from one shoulder to the other, then apply a prepared paste made of powder of molasses and egg white on all the muscle, so that it is turned upside down, and then tighten it with a strap below the tendon with tension; and let the ligament be turned over the paste, and the hand be connected to the neck, and be left like this, and not be held by the hand for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And when the patient's food is stopped briefly, until his member is comfortable, because it is better to wait for its recovery.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And then the food should be given every seven days or more, and exercise be made with the movement; and if it stops being soft and does not become so again, then it has healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	But if the joint is dislocated with visible moisture that occurs on it or for some other reason, then when cauterization is performed in front of it according to what is said in the chapter on cauterization.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if all this does not heal and the ligament is loose on it after seven days, then you know that its nerves are cut or extended or softened, and you know that the joint will never return to its place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	And from the dislocation of that which is done from below or above, the reduction is made with a sudden movement and extension to its maximum, while it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And let that other tension be administered, and let that cure be given until it is healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the recovery of the patient is delayed and there is little movement in his limb, then the patient uses water with visible moisture until that gravity is removed from him and he returns to his natural state first.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter xxvi.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	On the Cure of Muscular Dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	Know that the joint of the shoulder is dislocated with great difficulty and seems to return with the same difficulty; and it is dislocated from all sides, mainly from the front to the back, and the dislocation of it is not hidden when you adjust the dislocated one to its place, and then you declare it clearly because the joint is rounded and cannot bend the arm or touch with its hand according to some shape.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And when these cushions are put in place and the dislocation is reduced so far forward that it reaches the patient's chest, for if it reaches the patient's chest, reducing it is difficult, and it does not heal completely; and more so when it is at the back, because it is worse than all other types of dislocation and causes great pain and many blisters should be put on to prevent death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is that which can be reduced, is that the hand of it is extended to two times more, and the arms of it are spread out, and the sides of the body are placed on the cushion and leave it, and he presses the joint with its fingers or with the palm of his hand until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is at the front, then return it like this that he doubles his hand with his own hand, until he strikes the knee with his palm.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not obey to the reduction, then administer violent beating and very strong.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And it is that two ministers extend their arms, and hold this support for him two ministers so that he does not be shaken by the beating.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then return it like this that is wrapped a long folded cloth around his hand, or else.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the patient touches the joint with his hand, oil it with some oil so that those causes which help in lubrication of the joint with ease; and then press the joint with a violent push until it returns.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And the reduction of it, when it is placed on that cushion in which there is stinging and excision with alum of lead, and it is extended with a stricture downward, and the arm is suspended from the neck, and it is left for some days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	Then untie it; and if the joint is formed in its place, then untie the cloth from it and leave that one.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strong, then untie that cloth and tie it again, and leave that one for some days until it is dried up; and then untie it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if gravity occurs to it in the reduction of the joint, and its disposition is in movement, then administer humidification in a bath and gentle friction and compression, until it is relieved; or pause over the joint that is relaxed, so it is covered with a thick cloth; and then tie it, and leave that one on the bone for a day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	Then untie that one, and put it in a bath; and when it is relaxed, then you rub the joint with gentle friction, and then repeat over that one that is relaxed, so it makes noise of movement, once, twice, and third time,
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	The corruption has already come about on the skin of the body through the bath water, so that it is not limited.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you want, pause over that wound of cow that is wet and scraped with the border and press on it; and make several strokes, because that one is wet and reduces its disposition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of treatment of a dislocation that is in the shoulder, if it is at the joint that is between the arm and the hand.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	A dislocation of the hand has been moved, and the reduction of this dislocation is slight, and the opposite is true for other joints; but nevertheless, when it occurs that a dislocation is at the shoulder, then the reduction of it is quickly, before the place where it occurred reaches an apoplectism or if it occurs in an apoplectism.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	The reduction of the dislocation is that you stop the joint of the hand of the patient on a table and the minister extends the hand of it, and the patient stops his side or his palm over the edge of the joint, and presses it until it returns to its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But nevertheless, when the palm is already shown to the belly of the hand, then the patient stops the two sides of his hand on a table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation is previous, then stop the two sides of the hand, then place the hand of it intricately on the table, so that the side of the body covers that edge of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns quickly, then that is good; and if not, then return it with a cloth that gives an apoplectism and leave it; and do not repeat that, because there does not suffer nor can about the reduction of it for more than days.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	But nevertheless, the joint is second to its tortuosity; and there does not appear to the patient any cause, but the hand becomes soft and cannot be strong for any cause; then you know that the nerves are thin or many, and then it is not suitable to put a strong cautery on it at the bottom of it, because it can give some cause.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Then when the hand has returned to health, then return it on that cloth which you have re-covered, and leave it and strengthen it for five days; and then untie it and exercise the hand.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	But if the movement of it is still and occurs in it some gravity, then untie that one with a tail of water and several strokes, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of treatment of a dislocation in the fingers.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Some strokes are dislocated from the beginning.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when any finger is dislocated from the two sides of the palm or the belly of it, then press the joint and press its ends together, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	Then support the tip of the finger, and suspend that one from the part to which it is dislocated, and leave that one for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	Then hang that one up and extend that one within that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when night comes, then hang that one again according to that description, and do not stop untying that one during the day and exercising its movement, then hang that one at night; and make it straigh for several days.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same to the patient, if it is dislocated at the belly of the hand, and hang that one from the side to which it is dislocated, and make the first operation of that one, until it heals.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And in the same way, do to the patient if it is dislocated at the other sides.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of treatment of a dislocation in the spine of the back.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	And when it occurs in any of the vertebrae of the back or neck, and if some vertebrae do not move, then that is a complete dislocation; and if death comes to the patient, then put a pillow under him.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	And the sign of that one is that the vomit of the patient comes out without will; and it cannot hold those; and some members of its body or two sides of its clothes, or both of its clothes, or two bras of its body, or one of them; or if a vertebra moves from its place, because that sign appears and that sign appears.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that one is already re-moved to the back sides and is called gibletness.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	But the treatment of it is that you consider if gibletness comes from a child, because then there is no cure or healing for all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	But in that one that is dislocated by chance or by beating or similar to those, the old doctors have said many ways of treatment, some of which return with profit; and I have seen that one with which they are less profit, because it is near to my ear due to its nearness to my mouth; and with this I have heard and formed a different instrument from that with which I will show you and expand it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And I say that in the case of the pain that occurs at the front of the foot, it is not useful or healing for this; and similar to that which happens when it is made to two legs.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those are not cured except where it occurs in the two correctly as I have recommended it.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And the patient is extended on his face on a bed near the wall, and extended underneath him a moist instrument so that his feet are not touched.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	Then a stick is placed upright, fixed to the ground at the end of the foot around the head of the patient, and another stick is raised between the feet on the other side.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the minister holds the stick, and does not place it in a pit; and another minister holds the other according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And wrap the head of the patient and leave the latters to tickle his head hard; and extend the end of the latters to the stick that is meant for his head, and lay this on him; and approach the other latters and tighten them around his hips, leaving his legs uncovered, and adjust all the latters and lay these on the other stick that is meant for his feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And the minister drops the stick at the front of the two sticks and the latters that are meant for his limbs in their places, however, they are not tied in this way as I have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his palms on his spine with strength until he returns or puts them on a table, and approaches him to adjust his feet on the table before he returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if he does not return in this way, then take a table whose height or length is in a line with three brasas, and dig into the wall where I have said that the patient should be placed a place in which the end of the table meets.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And place the middle of the table on his spine, and the doctor places his feet on the other end, and adjust it well so that the spine is pinched and he returns to his place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want to, open the door that is rolled with your hand; and it is that you are on the ground the head of the patient at the back of the foot two sticks, the length of which is one braza, and the head of the patient at the back of the foot only two sticks; and let the length be between each stick a palm, and it has already been made in each stick through which the ball runs, and each is stopped on the ground so that it does not move.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And be a round stick in which the door is opened, and let it be rolled in the two turns of the two sticks.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of him is a turn in which the stick is formed, whose length is a palm to that it is rolled; and similar are the other two sticks.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And tighten the latters that you have placed on the feet of the patient in the turn that is meant for his head, and the latters that you have placed on the hips of the patient in the door that is meant for his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And approach each door and place a minister who twists the door with his hand, and the doctor pinches his spine as I have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the form of the door:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And when the spine has returned and its place is taken, then cover with a dry alumen, and wrap; and approach to put it on a table whose height is a third of six or around that quantity, and its length be the amount that takes up the space of the gelbosity, and at the front of the spine.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And let it be tied with the latters that I have said, and use the patient's food subtly as healing.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if there is any urgency in the place at the end of the healing, then cover to be administered medicines that soften and smoothen for the administration of the table over a long time, which I have recommended; and it has been administered at that place lead of lead.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And in some cases an imminence occurs at the back of the two spines, and it is detected by that dislocation; and this is the bone from which you have already noticed because it does not cover that he should be made to take this medicine, for it will be very difficult for him to die.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the thigh and the joint of the muscle do not come except by dislocation, and that it does not happen to those that happen to the other joints with little movement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the thigh is dislocated in four ways, because it is dislocated on the inside, or on the outside, or in front, or behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most commonly it is dislocated on the inside, and less in front or behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of the dislocation of him to the inside is four, when you adjust the curvature of the patient with his back to the spine, it becomes longer and its back more curved than that of a healthy person, and the patient cannot bend his tongue because it is broken; and this is the place where the tongue is broken by a break.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of that which happens to him in dislocation is to the outside, because the accidents of him are opposite to this accident.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of that which happens to him in dislocation to the front is four, however it does not bend that way because of the pain that it causes; and if it goes out through the front, his urine is held back and his tongue is broken, and he should walk on a stick.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of that which happens to him in dislocation to the back is that it does not spread out his back, nor can he bend his tongue forward because it bends his tongue; and his curvature is shorter than that, and his tongue is softened, and this is the place of the tongue.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	However, the reduction of these spices in this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and ancient, it has already been noticed because it was made to take a reduction from him, and if it is not in that cure of all; and therefore it does not cover that he should be made to take this reduction.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	However, in that which the dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four species of dislocation, then you should set the joint back to its place and extend it on the inside and outside, and turn it towards the right and left, for a strong person returns and does not need any other cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	However, if it does not return in this way, then cover that you prepare a minister strong and extend the back of the patient from the side where it is closest, or on his back, or with a lanyard that is tied around his back; and another minister extends the hand of the patient from behind his head, so that his feet are not touched; and tie the other lanyard to the foot of the patient.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And let it be extended from him or from the inside to the tongue at the back of the jaw, or from the back to the tongue at the front of the throat.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And let all these be extended in one way so that the patient is raised to his side on a table, and let it hang hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of expansion is similar to all four.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns as we have said, it is good; and otherwise, it is necessary for all kinds of water that I say about their own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of him himself, when dislocated, and the dislocation is to the inside, cover that the patient is raised over his own side; and approach the ligaments on the ridge of the crotch at this place which lies between the head of the crotch and the place where the tongue is left; and extend the ligament in its part of the leg on the uppermost part of the femur.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister takes hold of the legs with great power, and rubs the thick part of the crotch with violent expansion; because that returns to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type is the most difficult cure for this member is reduced, than for other types of treatment.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is lifted up by you and does not obey the entrance into this type of treatment of all, then consider that the two feet of the patient are tied together with a strong ligature; soft, gentle, on both toes and both heels.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each one of them by the quantity of four said, and the crotch is extended more than the other by a quantity of two said.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And the crotch is suspended above the top of the post, and it is on the greatest; and the length of him is from the ground a quantity of two feet.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And another young man takes hold of the head of the crotch and it is suspended on him himself with a strong strap; because the joint returns to its place by speed.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the reduction of him himself, when dislocated to the outside, consider that the patient watches his own foot according to what we have said by taking off his shoes and socks; and be strong the ligament on the crotch itself and on the feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And two posts are placed, the one on the feet of him himself and the other on his head; and two posts are adjusted in the middle of the foot where the drape is wrapped over it, so that the patient is not dampened by the post being between the thighs of him himself, otherwise the expansion to the outside will be pulled.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister extends in its part, and the doctor with his hand embraces the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey in reverse, it will be good greatly; and otherwise, pause carefully on that place and then so as we have said in taking off your shoes and socks by that embrace.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But consider that the patient watches his own side with quietness.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is to the front, consider that the crotch is extended gently, and it is according to this narration about a post; and the doctor pauses his right palm on the crotch of him himself, and approaches that place with the other hand, and at that corner extends that which is placed on both sides to the outside.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is to the back, then consider that the crotch is extended to the outside, and it is lifted up from the ground; because he is placed on a hard surface, so that when the width of him is dislocated to the inside, according to what we have said about his expansion between two widths, and its sides are extended, as we have said, there is no resistance.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And consider that the compression is applied to a table on the place where the joint is located.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, when the reduction is completed as you said— and the symbol of the reduction of him himself does not retreat to you, and it is that you extend two crotches for him, and when you see those crotches and he extends his own crotch by a band like that it is not broken in either of the sides; then you tie him up on rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then release the ligament and the bandage, and compare one crotch with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And then, if you see those crotches in a vestment, then you know that the dislocation is already stopped, and let him go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any sign of softening, then you return and bandage that one again, and extend it according to your first extension, and let him rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then release that one, and make that one walk a little bit every day until it is comfortable again.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter LXXII.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of Treatment of Dislocation from the Bottom.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The bottom is dislocated according to three ways, because it is dislocated to the outside, and to the inside, and to the outside at the back; and it is not dislocated to the front.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the symbol of dislocation for him himself is that you command the crotch to apply its own crotch; then you know that the bottom is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all his ways is that you take hold of him with your right hand, and then consider that he has already extended his own crotch, if he can on it; attach the two ties to his face, and pause his feet between the ties; and another minister extends his legs between the ties over his back with strength, and another minister attaches his feet to your palms, and those between the ties on his heels with strength, and another minister raises his legs up until the bottom returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the symbol of recovery for him is that his crotch adheres to the crotch with a light, gentle movement.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then bandage that one and attach his crotch to the crotch, and then tie those ties on a band with a light band for three days or four, and then release those ties.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And do not use the crotch for walking for some days, until it is healed and comfortable again.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction of him to you is justified, then consider that I will administer a strong expansion for those ligaments in the treatment of the post.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter LXXIII.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of Treatment of Dislocation from the Top.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The top is sometimes relieved by a little removal, and sometimes it is dislocated according to the complement, and its dislocation is caused or to the inside or to the outside.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the symbol of dislocation for him is that he deflates at the place where he is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	And the treatment of his removal is of gentle recovery, and it is that he is extended with ease until his place and is enclosed so that he returns to his place.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	And in the treatment of him when he is dislocated according to the complement, consider that you take hold of him with your right hand, and have another minister who is strong and capable at his back in the middle position of him himself.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then turn yourself to me with your right palm on the top of the highest part, and with your left hand on the lowest part of the foot in its position.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then throw his feet to you with your right palm, and then with your left hand for two times, and then extend them with your left hand; and bandage the feet with your right hand while his legs are working under the band.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make him walk two times according to what we have said.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And bring the feet of the foot to the third bed, and you are on the mat.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So return in one or two veiled like this way, and if the foot is covered, it is good; and if not, then do the operation again over him, because he returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if to you it is forbidden to reduce him thus that we have mentioned, then make the patient lie on his back on the ground, and put a sheet over him, and wrap him in clothes, and you will see.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And the minister of him has his knees, and another minister extends the foot on its feet or lightly on the hip; and another minister extends that against the extension of his side, and the cushion is extended between the thighs of the patient to hold it so that its back is not pulled at the joints.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor holds the dislocation with his feet, and another minister holds the sound knee at the joint, because the dislocation comes easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And now that the dislocation returns and is declared to you the health of the reduction of him, then pause and apply oil strongly, and bind the foot to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And watch out for or protect the nerves that are behind on the tibia, so that the joint over it is not violent and tears it strongly.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	Then let him lie for two days or three; and if the joint has softened, then apply oil to him.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And after that time, then wash him with water on the third day, and forbid the patient to move for ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to move forward that space, it is not safe that the dislocation is over him dissolved and corrupted, and then apply oil so that he does not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	But if it happens to him that the poultice is hot, then watch out for you to apply on his body water in which we preceded in our narration, in another place of treatment and ointment, until it is cool again.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of treatment for the dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	But if the one who is dislocated is covered with a little oil, it will work better; and that which is not difficult, advance slowly.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in a certain number of toes of the foot, then watch out that you make a cut on his body over the ground or table, and let him go like this; and let him walk thus.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand on your feet, and pause the big foot over it that is under the joints, and then step on him with your big toe carefully so that he returns, and you see if it is covered and not in the prominent place.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then pause the belly of the foot on a table that takes all of it, which are two heads, and then tighten him well and firmly for three days; and then wash him and let him rest from walking for ten days, until he is healed and his recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the species of dislocation that are caused by plague or fracture or any combination.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When such a cause happens to you, and you are engaged in the treatment of that person and in the recovery of him, watch out for the following things:
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And by the foot do not presume over the treatment of him, but that which is skilled in the art, long-suffering, merciful and compassionate, tardy, not impatient nor proud; and that uses in the beginning of medicine that soft poultices so much only, and lets the patient to the divine judgment, but you hope for salvation from destruction, with the alleviation of evil, and in which there appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then try to make him well as soon as possible from the beginning of the cause, before he develops a poultice of caustic.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the member returns as soon as possible, then administer to him that soft poultice that heals the plague with water that you give him of the herbs drying.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is from a fracture and you hit the bones that are separated, then you strike them with your staff, and do in him so that he does not have simple pain of him who has preceded in the places of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And protect and avoid according to your ability that instrument in the paths of fear according to which you have preceded my proclamation; for it is better to you devotes the Creator, and remains permanent in your glory, and salutes the true face of him who is in the true time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Al-Bucasımi clearly explaining the reasons for which God did not want to be worshiped.
Amen.	Amen.
